De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q  4,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de papa y su fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña con expandir su cultivo en otras parcelas y darles estudios académicos a sus hijos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano is a farmer of 37 years of age. He has a simple relationship with his wife and he lives in Sololá. He has three sons studying in a community school and they help him in the field in their free time.

He works growing onions and potatoes on plots that he has a few meters from his house. He learned from his father when he was little because he helped out in the fields and it was his first job.

He has spent 15 years farming on his own and being independent and seeing that he is getting good earnings, he is growing these vegetables. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 quetzales so he can buy potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivating and harvesting to improve the family income.

His dream is to expand his cultivation to other farmlands and to provide his children an education to improve the conditions of life for all his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku describes herself as a hardworking woman with the desire to move forward. She is a married mother of seven children, none of whom are in school. She has been operating a vegetable stall for the last seven years, selling the vegetables from her home. Maku says that she faces the challenge of seasonality and theft of her products. Despite these adversities, she has been able to remain in business, which has helped her cater for the household expenses.

Maku wants to increase her merchandise but she says that she does not have enough working capital, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her stall. This way she is sure to satisfy her customers and at the same time provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her food stall

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak is from a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is a 39-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She has struggled to feed her children by growing garlic in the local area. Having been in this business for 16 years, she is able to earn about 6,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Lak has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She and her group member are requesting a loan of 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Lak will use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. Lak hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily consumption so as to improve a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a decent latrine

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 62 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en: Robelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years, and earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Robelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: Claudia Carolina de 31 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de joyeria y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la elaboracion de costuras a maquina, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, y gracias a Dios le a hido bien en su negocio, está solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia y surtir más su negocio.
texts.en: Claudia Carolina is 31 and sells jewelry and sews.  She has been doing this for several years and thanks to God things have gone well for her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise and stock her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alex Adan

texts.es:
El  Señor Alex tiene 37 años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20  años a la venta de  refrescos, arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, carme, pollo, embutidos, pastas, salsas, su negocio está  ubicado en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan. 
Don Alex está solicitando 25,000.00 lempiras para compra de carne, huevos, refrescos, mantaca, frijoles, salsa, leche, queso, jabón, embutidos, agua, pastas, salsas, churros y pan.
Don Alex su sueño es compararse un carro donde pueda transportarse.   

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Alex is 37 years old and lives in a home of his own, located in the San Lorenzo community of Honduras.  He has been selling soft drinks, rice, beans, lard, eggs, meat, chicken, sausages, pasta, salsas, churros, and bread for the past 20 years.  His business is in his home and his customers are friends and neighbors.

Alex is asking for 25,000 Lempiras to buy meat, eggs, soft drinks, lard, beans salsa, milk, cheese, soap, sausages, water, pasta, salsa, churros, and bread.  His dream is to buy himself a car.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (pictured here), 42, is a tailor. His wife, Savy, 42, is a garment worker. They live in in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, one attends school and the other one assists his father in a fishing business.

In addition, Savy also grows rice when rice-farming season comes. And when fishing season allows, he fishes with help from his son.  

Savy is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a water pumping machine to spray his rice farm because the old one is broken.

loans.use: to buy a water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.name: Union Femenil Del Comercio Group

texts.es:
La señora Anastasia es viuda, tiene 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 5 estan estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes y guipiles típicos del lugar donde vive y de otros lugares, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo, hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara, para la compra de materiales, tales como hilos y labores de diferentes colores y diseños, espera seguir mejorando, ya que quiere tener mayor capital y mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Anastasia is a 45-year-old woman, widow and mother of 5 children, all of whom are studying. She did not have the opportunity to study and makes a living weaving textiles and guipiles [traditional blouses] from where she lives and from other areas. She started this business thanks to the support of her husband and, as of today, she has 8 years of experience. 

She has put together a group to request a loan that she will use to buy materials, such as threads and textiles in different colors and designs. She expects to continue improving as she wants to attain greater capital and income. The other members in the group make artisan crafts.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving textiles and guipiles [traditional blouses].

loans.name: Loem Ang

texts.en:
Loem Ang (in the photo) is single. She lives with her parents and brother and sister in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Loem Ang works in a village office. She is also in farming business when she is free. She grows jujube. 

Loem Ang is asking for another loan in the amount of $600 to maintain her jujube farm by buying pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.use: To maintain her jujube farm by buying pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy, 39, is an entrepreneur  from Zamboanga del Sur. She is married to Ramon Magsaysay, and has 1 child. She started her retail business almost 2 years ago and now earns 7,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing 30,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit – which she just joined recently – to buy items such as milks, diapers, food products, etc.  Before long, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as milks, diapers, food products, etc.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en: As a married parent of 4 children, Ninfa works hard to support her family. She has a computer service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice grinding.  She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer for her business. Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. Thanks to the previous loan that helped her stock up her business, she says that she was able to include the sale of charcoal in her firewood selling business. Mariam dreams of having several businesses in the future so that she can continue providing her family with a good quality of life. With this new investment, she will be able to buy more bundles of firewood and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of firewood and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Leangsim's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sa Ang district, Leangsim is 43 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are still in school.  She has been planting and selling garlic in the local area to support her family for 10 years. She is able to earn about 7,000 KHR per day, and manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Leangsim is leading her group of four to request her first microloan from Kiva partner VisionFund.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy materials for building a decent latrine, such as a latrine bowl, tile draining, sewage, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent latrine

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than was born in 1953. She has four children who work as laborers and farmers; one is a student. Her husband sells tobacco to earn a living. His income is about 4,000,000 VND. Than is a farmer who raises pigs, and earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Than has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  es un hombre agricultor de 31  años de edad, el está en unión simple junto a su esposa  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene tres hijos de ellos uno es  varón  y  dos mujeres.
 Ellos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo en tiempos libres.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, papa y repollo  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde niño cuando el estudiaba en la escuela primaria y ayudaba en el campo de la agricultura y eso fue su primer trabajo.
El ahora cuenta con cinco años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 10,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de papa, plantillas de repollo y su fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña con expandir su cultivo mejorando sus ganancias y  terminar de construir una vivienda que tiene para  su familia y darles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 31-year-old farmer in a common-law marriage with his wife and he lives in Sololá.  He has three children: one boy and two girls.  They study in a school in the community and support him in the field in their free time.

He makes a living in agriculture cultivating onions, potatoes and cabbage in plots that he has a few meters from his home.  This he learned from his father when he was a child studying in primary school and helping in the field of agriculture and that was his first job.

He has now spent five years doing his own farming seeing that he obtains good profits cultivating these vegetables.  He is requesting a loan of 10,000 quetzales (GTQ) so that he can buy potato seeds, cabbage seedlings and fertilizer to cultivate and harvest them, improving the family's income.

He dreams of expanding his crops, improving his profits, finishing the construction of a house that he has for his family and giving them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and cabbage seedlings to cultivate.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es: Doña  Martha tiene 55 años de edad, es miembro del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es una familia muy trabajadora y unida, su esposo es agricultor y también se dedica a la ganadería. Doña Martha inicio su negocio desde hace cinco años tiene instalada una pulpería en su hogar y también horna y vende pan, su horario de atención inicia desde las 6:00 am y culmina a las 9:00 pm. Su ventaja es que la pulpería tiene muy buena ubicación. El préstamo que doña Martha esta solicitando lo necesita para surtir su negocio y lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, manteca, frijoles, jabón, detergente, productos lácteos, refrescos, churros, dulces, harina, embutidos, etc. Ella espera que con el apoyo de este préstamo sus ingresos aumenten y así poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Su sueño es mejorar su pulpería y que sea una de las más surtidas de la zona. Doña Martha tiene 4 años de solicitar préstamos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus compromisos de pago de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old. She is a member of Banco Comunal Nueva Luz, is married and has five children. It is a very hardworking and close-knit family. Her husband is a farmer and also works at cattle raising. Martha began her business five years ago. She has set up a store in her home, as well as an oven, and sells bread. Her work schedule begins at 6:00 am and ends at 9:00 pm. To her advantage, the store is in a very good location.

Martha needs the loan she is requesting to stock her business and invest in the purchase of products like rice, lard, beans, soap, detergent, dairy products, soft drinks, churros, sweets, flour, sausages, etc. She hopes that with the help of this loan, her income will grow and therefore enable her to assist her husband with home expenses. Her dream is to improve her store and have one of the most stocked stores in the area. Martha has requested loans from FAMA for four years and has fulfilled her payment commitments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy general grocery items.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, who was born in 1957, has three children who are drivers and chicken egg sellers. Her husband is a farmer with a monthly income of 2,000,000 VND. Hoa has been raising pigs and chickens to earn a living for 18 years, making about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Hoa has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007, having last borrowed and repaid 9,632,000 VND. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,080,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens and pigs. Working hard to earn more money for her family, she hopes to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is from Taguitic, Kapatagan. She is 38 years old. Lilian is married and has four children. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling crabs. She has been in her business for five years and earns PHP 6,000 a month from this activity. 

Lilian joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which she will use to buy additional crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Maelyn

texts.en:
Maelyn, 32, is married and resides at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Maelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 doing this business. 

This year, Maelyn joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, to purchase new items to diversify her product offerings. Maelyn aims for future business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase new items, to diversify the product offerings of her store.

loans.name: Sahobiddin

texts.ru: Сахобиддин родился в 1955 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена Гульсара домохозяйка и она занимается воспитанием детей. Дети Танзима, Салохидин, Джамшед, Бибихалима учатся в школе и университете. Сахобиддин занимается скотоводством более 12 лет, но его доход не позволяет ему оплатить за учебы сына в университете, так как Джамшед  учится в университете. Он очень способный парень. В свободное время читает книги и занимается спортом.  Сахобиддин запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете.  Сахобиддин и Джамшед ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sahobiddin was born in 1955.  He is married and is raising 4 children.  His wife, Gulsara, is a homemaker and raises the children.  The children: Tanzima, Salohidin, Djamshed, and Bibihalima study at school and university.  Sahobiddin has been raising livestock for over 12 years, but his income does not allow him to pay for his son's university studies as Djamshed attends university.  He is a very capable young man.  In his free time he reads books and participates in sports.  Sahobiddin is asking for a loan to pay for his son's university studies.  Sahobiddin and Djamshed are waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходуру 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена Насиба очень умная и добрая женщина. Баходур счастлив, что имеет такую хорошую жену. Дети еще не в состоянии помогать родителям для содержания семьи. Итак, Баходур основной кормилец в семье. Он старается из-за всех сил обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Он более 6 лет работает электриком. Он предоставляет услугу электрика местным жителям и получает доход от этого. Он в состоянии купить продукты питания и другие средства для проживания. Однако у него нет сбережения, чтобы начать ремонт и улучшить условия дома. Его дом уже старый и должен отремонтировать все комнаты, начиная с зала до детской и кухни. У него дома нет условия для проведения зимы и ему необходим займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Он обещает погасить займ во время. Баходур и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Bahodur is 42 years old.  He is married and is raising 4 children.  His wife, Nasiba, is a very smart and kind woman.  Bahodur is happy that he has such a good wife.  The children are not yet able to help the parents support the family.  Therefore, Bahodur is the main provider in the family.  He tries with all his might to provide the family with all the necessary resources.  He has been working as an electrician for more then 6 years.  He provides electrical services to local residents and earns an income this way.  His house is already old and he needs to repair all the rooms, starting with the entryway and continuing on to the children's room and kitchen.  His house is not winterized and he needs a loan of 2000 somoni for the purchase of building materials.  He promises to pay back the loan on time.  Bahodur and his children will wait until kind creditors help them to solve their housing problems.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair house

loans.name: Sinalaupepa

texts.en: Sinaluapepa is a 22-year-old, married woman, who has three children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community, to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Sinaluapepa needs a loan to develop her business. She plans to use her profits to help her small family with financial issues. Sinaluapepa joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of foam cups, cordials, sugar, mixture, to use in making her ices to sell.

loans.name: Sisilia

texts.en: Sisilia is 43 years old and married, and she has four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas, which she can sell in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sisilia needs a loan to buy tools and farm inputs, like knives, weed spray, a spade, and a wheelbarrow, to use in growing and harvesting her crops. Sisilia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy tools and farm inputs, like knives, weed spray, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years. She also earns income from raising livestock and selling poultry supplies.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF, to buy additional stock to resell in her store, like canned goods, shampoo, coffee and soap. Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to resell in her store, including canned goods, shampoo, coffee and soap.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc was born in 1979. She has four children who are learning at secondary school, primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a barber and gets 2,500,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Cuc also is a barber for women to earn a living. Her income is about 2,500,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy scissors and barber tools for her barber shop. She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income to enable her children to have good careers.

loans.use: to buy scissors and barber tools for her barber shop.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is a married woman with six grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a bakery for five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband also has a small business which will help her to meet their daily needs.

Morena is asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs, oil, sugar and baking soda. These ingredients will be used in making bread, and she will sell it in her local community. 

In the future, Morena dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, oil, sugar and baking soda for making bread.

loans.name: Dúo Flor De Maiz Group

texts.es:
DUO FLOR DE MAIZ
Doña Maria Ramona es originaria de Tecpan ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones y a la crianza de pollos. Desde hace varios años ella viene realizando esta actividad ya que es el medio que ha tenido para salir adelante. 
Doña Ramona vende sus refacciones en en el mercado municipal de tecpan ya que ella ya es bien conocida por sus clientes  por su negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue realizando su actividad ya que su esposo lo apoya moral y económicamente.
Ella sueña ampliar mas su negocio  para ofrecer variedad de productos para  obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida, ya tuvo un crédito Kiva y sus pagos los hizo a la fecha no cayo en mora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion de refacciones.
texts.en:
DUO FLOR DE MAIZ

Maria Ramona is from Tecpan. She sells snacks and raises chickens. She has done this activity for several years and it is how she has gotten ahead.  
 
Ramona sells her snacks in the city market of Tecpan and she is well known by her customers from her business. Thanks to her husband's support she continues with this activity, since he is her moral and financial support.

She dreams of expanding her business more to offer a variety of  products and to improve her quality of life. She already had a Kiva loan and she made her payments on time without falling behind. She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise to make her snacks.

loans.use: to buy edible merchandise for making snacks

loans.name: Vaipapa

texts.en: Vaipapa is a 22-year-old, married woman, who has three children. She makes and sells ice cream cones in her community, to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Vaipapa needs a loan to buy ice creams and cones. She plans to use her profits to help support her family and develop her business. Vaipapa joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy ice cream flavors, cones, and a freezer.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 42-year-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 13. All of them go to school. 

Alfred runs a clothing store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan Limited through promotions by the loan officers. 

He is taking a loan of 4000 SSP to purchase more clothes and other items. In addition to this business, Alfred has no other source of income.

In five years, Alfred would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Alfred says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan Limited, through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and other items for his clothing store.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel le fue muy bien con su anterior credikiva, pues compró mucho pescado y lo vendió, generando una vez mas utilidades nuevas en su negocio; con su nuevo credikiva, al que hoy aplica, comprará al por mayor y de contado pescado, como sable corvina, carito, cojinúa, sierra, robalo, pargo, jurel y langostinos, con esta inversión responderá a su acreditada clientela de Puerto Colombia, en una temporada muy rentable comercialmente y esto es justamente donde radica el éxito de su credikiva. Angel envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Que la santísima virgen los colme de bendiciones a ustedes y sus familias por la generosidad mostrada con los pequeños empresarios del mundo. “
texts.en:
Angel did very well with his last Kiva loan.  He bought and sold a lot of fish, once again generating profits for his business.  With his new Kiva loan, which he is now applying for, he will buy fish at wholesale on a cash basis.  He will buy fish such as: largehead hairtail, corvina, painted mackerel, blue runner,  Spanish mackerel, sea bass, snapper, Crevalle Jack, and prawns.  With this investment, he will be able to respond to the demands coming from his established customer base in Puerto Colombia.   This is a season that is commercially very profitable, and this will be precisely the reason for his success with this Kiva loan.  

Angel wants to send the following message to the Kiva lenders: "May the Blessed Virgin shower you and your families with blessings for the generosity you have shown towards the small-businessmen and women of the world."

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale

loans.name: Gerley

texts.en:
Gerley is from San Jose, Aurora in the Philippines. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. 

To make a living, Gerley owns and operates a general store. Gerley has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 4,000 PHP per month for these activities. In 2011, Gerley joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

Gerley is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items for her general store, such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Tomngai Group

texts.en:
This is Tomngai group, which consists of eight members. These hard working Tribal women live in a small village on the outskirts of Senapati district in Manipur State located in the Northeastern part of India. This part of the state still lacks developmental programs, which is why these women came together as a group in 2008 to help one another to take a loan.

Nengneilam is the group leader. She is pictured with her hand raised. She is 39 years old and a mother to four sons and a daughter. All her children go to a private school nearby. Her husband's main source of income comes from cutting wood, which is a time-consuming process to turn into money. In order to supplement the family income, she took a loan to bridge the gap of cash flow by undertaking income-generating activities.

With her first loan in 2008, she bought 3,000 pineapple saplings to grow at her farm. It takes three to four months time to harvest. With the sale profits, she was able to repay her loan and attend to the family needs such as the children's schooling fees and needs. With her second loan, she managed to cultivate on a larger scale. She purchased more pineapple saplings to increase her production. Effortlessly, she met her loan liability and with the profit, she, along with her husband's help, built a new house to live in, which is under construction. Together with her husband, she plans to provide a good education to the children.

At first, her husband was indifferent to her taking a loan. Now she is very happy that with the success that she had, her husband is willing to support her in sharing the loan responsibility. She is all the more excited that her husband actually suggested that he take the responsibility of tending the farm for her next cultivation. 

Now she needs another loan to continue with pineapple cultivation. She will use the loan to buy more pineapple saplings to cultivate. She hopes that she enjoys a good harvest like the previous harvest and with the profit to spare, she means to finish building her house, which is half done.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too needed another loan to continue to benefit from their respective income activities. Pineapple cultivation comprises most of the activities of this group. One member has a piggery and another member opened a general store to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase pineapple saplings to cultivate and sell for profit.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 66 años de edad es madre de 9 hijos en las edades e 24 a 36 años; ella se dedica a la venta de carne de res, vísceras, especialmente los fines de semana y desde hace 32 años, cuando inició este negocio con el fin de apoyar es sustento de su hogar y solventar los gastos familiares. Los productos los ofrece en la puerta de su vivienda donde instala una mesa con ellos, y los vende por libras, un 80% son de contado y 20% a crédito. Sus compras las realiza en municipios cercanos donde hay mataderos especializados  que le venden a un buen precio. En la actualidad ha aplicado a 3 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que ha logrado aumentar sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades, así como es muy notorio el incremento de su clientelas. Su meta mas adelante en aumentar sus ventas en una cifra no menor del 38% y mejorar la infraestructura física de su vivienda, por eso se esmera en trabajar duro y con orden. En la actualidad  María está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen carnes, que le permitirán acceder a un mayor descuentos y ofrecer a sus clientes oportunidades de compras con buenos precios, aprovechando que usualmente en la época de navidad y año nuevo, se incrementa el volumen de clientes, que necesitan comprar cárnicos para atender familiarmente las fiestas de navidad  y año nuevo que están muy cercanas y en la cual todos se sienten muy felices celebrándolas en unidad .
texts.en:
María is 66 years old and the mother of nine children between the ages of 24 and 36.  She sells beef and entrails on the weekends and has been doing this for 32 years.  She began this business to help support her household.  She sells from her front door where she sets up a table for her products and sells them by the pound.  80% of her sales are for cash and 20% for credit.  She makes her purchases in the nearby towns where there are slaughterers and sell at good prices.

María currently has had three previous loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she was able to increase her sales and noticed an increase in the number of customers.  Her goal is to increase her sales in the future, no less than 38%, and improve her home’s infrastructure, so she works hard and organized.  She is asking for a Kiva loan to buy meat in quantity.  This will allow her to access larger discounts and offer better deals to her customers.

She wants to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year season, when her number of customers increases.  Their needs to buy meat products for the family Christmas and New Year festivals that are around the corner and when everyone is in a good mood and united.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Martaba

texts.ru: Мартаба опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Ей 23 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Ее муж пекарь. Ее ребенку 3 года. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 4 года назад она начала свой бизнес шитьем женских национальных платьев. Она работает в ателье в центре города. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Ее клиенты женщины со вкусом и очень трудно их удовлетворять, но Мартаба с легкостью справляется с их капризами. Мартабу местные люди очень уважают и доверяют, так как она очень добросовестная женщина. Она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки новой швейной машинки. Она обещает погасить займ во время.  Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Martaba is an experienced seamstress. She excels at sewing traditional Tajik dresses. She is 23 years old. She is married and raising a child. Her husband is a baker. Her child is 3 years old. In order to provide for her family, four years ago she launched her business sewing traditional national women's clothing. She works in a sewing shop downtown. Thanks to her good service, she has a wide customer base. Her clients are women of demanding taste, and are hard to please, but Martaba  easily manages to satisfy their whims. Martabu is respected and trusted in the neighborhood, because she is very conscientious. She needs a new sewing machine, but her income doesn't allow for it. She is requesting a loan in the amoutn of 3,000 TJS in order to buy a new sewing machine. She promises to pay her loan back on time. She is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es: Robinson invirtió su credikiva anterior en calzado deportivo, de marcas  reconocidas, y con ello generó más ingresos para el buen desempeño de su hogar. Hoy está aplicando aun nuevo financiamiento, con el cual comprará cubrelechos, calzado, electrodomésticos menores, que están encargados por sus mejores clientes y aumentarán su cartera de crédito en manos de personas muy responsables, y esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Robinson invested his Kiva loan into well-known brands of sports shoes and generated more income for his household.  Now he is asking for another loan to buy comforters, shoes, and small appliances that his best customers have ordered from him.  He will sell on credit to very responsible people.  This is what will guarantee the success of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sahei Group

texts.en:
This is the Sahei group, which consists of eight members and was formed in 2008. They all belong to the Tribal community and hail from a small village located on the outskirts of Sadar Hills in Manipur State in the northeastern part of India. They came together as a group to help one another to take a loan.

Lhaingah, pictured with her hand raised, is the profile representative of the group. Since 1996, she has been living a widow's life. She is a mother to three sons and a daughter. All by herself, she shoulders parentat responsibilities trying to educate the children. She is very happy that now the two older children are on the verge of completing their graduation and the younger two are still pursuing their intermediate grade. She had done farming activities on rented land before her loan. Usually she would labor as a wage earner for extra income. In order to have a break, she abandoned the rented land to avoid paying high revenue to the landowners while she sweats.

In 2008 with her first loan, she bought two piglets to raise. In order to repay her loan, she sold one pig after four months to meet her loan liability. At the end of the year, the full grown other pig gave her a good income. With her second loan, she increased her production by raising four piglets. All her children help her by gathering waste food house to house for the pigs on a daily basis. From the sale proceeds of one pig, she bought pineapple saplings to grow in her homestead garden to sell at the market. In this way, she has been struggling to keep up and manage her children's education.

She always wanted to renovate her house's thatch roof to weather condition tin sheets and she has been saving but as usual, the savings will be used for the children's needs. She plans to execute her tin roof plans the following year, provided she is in good enough health to raise more piglets. Now she needs another loan to continue her piggery activities for better fortune. She will use the loan to buy at least four more piglets (preferably two female piglets for reproduction) to raise for profit. She also means to use part of the loan to buy new clothing for her younger children for the Christmas celebration. 
   
Likewise, the rest of the group members too need another loan to supplement their income activities. Pineapple farming, poultry farming, vegetable farming and vegetable selling are the preferable activities that the group is engaged in.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en: Katiba is 42 years old. She is an enterprising woman and mother of seven children. Two years ago, she decided to start an activity that would keep her busy and at the same time generate some income. That is why she grows vegetables with the support of her family. Katiba grows a variety of vegetables, which she later sells at the market and from her home. Having obtained her fifth Yehu loan, she can continue producing and firmly confronting her problems. It helps to support her children's future and her confidence. She will use the KSH 30,000 loan to buy vegetable seeds and sacks of organic manure and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and sacks of organic manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for two years. Roselyn earns more income from her general store.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Faialofa

texts.en: Faialofa is a 60-year-old married woman with 10 children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas, tomatoes and cucumbers to earn a living. Faialofa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a napsack, a sprayer, knives, a spade, a file, etc..for her plantation. Faialofa will spend her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a knapsack, a sprayer, knives, a spade, a file, etc.

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon and the father of three children. He has worked in car maintenance for fourteen years. He has wide experience as a mechanic, which provides him with his customers' trust.

His business is the lone source of income for his family. For this reason, he works hard to keep on improving and developing it. Radwan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to undergo eye surgery and finish paying for his car.

This is Radwan's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in his business in a well-managed way. Radwan hopes to keep on improving and developing his business as much as he can.

loans.use: to undergo eye surgery and finish paying for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two computers and a hot dog cart.

loans.name: Judith Erlinda

texts.es: Judith se dedica al comercio de artesanías y a la venta de ropa interior y lácteos; en el pasado recibió un credikiva con el cual compró en mayor volumen estos productos, los vendió y aumentó su capital de trabajo. Ella dice a sus financiadores que tiene mucho agradecimiento con ellos, por apoyarla y que hoy  está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará artesanías de Tuchin-departamento de Córdoba, como Mochilas, sombreros, queso, ropa femenina e infantil para vender en el departamento de Bolívar, donde tiene muchos pedidos de almacenes de artesanías que combinan estos artículos de cada región para tener una excelente muestra en sus inventarios.
texts.en: Judith sells crafts, undergarments, and dairy products.  She received a Kiva loan in the past and used it to buy products in bulk, which she sold and increased her working capital.  She says that she is very grateful to the lenders for supporting her and that today she is applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy crafts from Tuchi, Córdoba department, such as book bags, hats, cheese, and women’s and children’s clothing to sell in the Bolívar department, where she has many requests from art shops that sell items from different regions.  She wants to have a good assortment of her products to show.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Adanies

texts.es: Adanis  de 24 años de edad, vive en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí se dedica a vender productos farmacéuticos desde hace 4 años, aunque adquirió su experiencia cuando trabajó en una droguería. Sus ventas las realiza de contado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9:30 de la noche; sus compras las realiza a crédito y de contado en almacenes mayoristas. Su meta más adelante es abrir sucursales, pero su gran desafío es tener el capital suficiente, para invertir y con ello mejorar sus condiciones económicas poco a poco. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, medicamentos para responder a la gran rotación que estos tienen y mantener una existencia con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, que es la razón de ser de su negocio generador de ingresos para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Adanis is 24 years old and lives near Barranquilla, where he has been selling pharmaceutical products for four years.  He gained experience when he worked in a drugstore.  He sells for cash starting at 8:00 am to 9:30 pm.  He makes his purchases for cash and credit from large suppliers.  His goal is to open branches but his greatest challenge is his lack of capital to make this investment so that he can improve his living conditions little by little.

He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can buy medications in quantity, so that he can respond to the sales and have products on hand to satisfy his customers, which is the reason he has this business, so that he can generate income for his wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina is a 18 year old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Sabrina needs a loan to buy items like an oven and flour, sugar, and bottles of oil. She plans to use her profits to help support her family. Sabrina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment and ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 49-year old resident of Anonang, Aurora. Fe provides for her three children's needs from the small amount of 8,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own pig business. She has maintained this business for five years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

This year she became a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP at GDMPC Microfinance to buy feeding supplies. Fe wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Niuperiti

texts.en:
Niuperiti is a 25-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells bags of popcorn in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Niuperiti needs a loan to buy ingredients to make popcorn. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support to her family. Niuperiti has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, corn seeds, butter, and salt.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian invirtió  su anterior credikiva,  en la modernización de sus computadores, con ello ganó más clientela, porque los equipos dejaron de ser lentos y hoy sus clientes se sienten más satisfechos, acreditando su negocio en toda la zona de acceso.  Durante el periodo de crédito logró hacer mejoramientos a su vivienda y también celebra el nacimiento de dos sobrinos, lo  cual quiere compartir como una de sus principales novedades familiares que lo hacen felíz. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es de mucho agradecimiento, en nombre de las personas que presentan discapacidad, pues pese a ella han logrado salir adelante, cumpliendo a cabalidad con los pagos puntuales de su crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual hará mejoramiento a los pisos de su negocio que faciliten su desplazamiento es su especial silla, pues el piso actual es corrugado y está averiado.
texts.en:
Cristian invested his previous Kiva loan into updating his computers and he gained more customers because the equipment was no longer slow and his customers are better satisfied.  During the loan period, he made some improvements to his home and also celebrated the birth of his two nephews, with whom he wants to share as news from the family that makes him happy.

His message to the Kiva lenders is of great appreciation in the name of people with disabilities.  It’s because of this that they have been able to get ahead and make their payments on time.  He is asking for a new Kiva loan with which he will make some improvements to the floors at his business location.  This will make it easier for him to move around in this special chair; the current floor is faulty and has ruts.

loans.use: to make improvements to his business location.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dúo Patzun Group

texts.es:
Dúo Patzun. La señora María Mercedes,  es muy trabajadora le lo que hace que es vender y tiene su negocio,  ya qué solo así ha podido salir adelante  ella es madres soltera  y no hay nadie quien la ayude y gracias a Dios le va bien se esfuerza en ofrecer su producto ella vende vajillas de trastos de cocina  y también licuadoras. Esta vez tiene la oportunidad de viajar a Tapachula México  para  comprar su producto ya qué haya consiguen cosas bonitas y baratas y quiere aprovechar para invertir  y ofrecer a sus clientes producto bueno de buena calidad . el deseo de ella es luchar para pagar su crédito que solicita y no quedar mal y seguir adelante mientras Dios 
Les presta vida.
texts.en: María Mercedes is a hardworking woman who sells things and has her own business.  This is the only way she has been able to get ahead.  She is a single mother with no one to help her, but thanks to God things are going well for her and she makes an effort to provide her products; she sells kitchen utensils, and blenders.  This time she has the chance to travel to Tapachula, Mexico to buy her products.  She buys nice, inexpensive things there and wants to take advantage of this so that she can offer her customers good products at good prices.  Her wish is to work hard so that she can replay this loan and not be in bad light and continue ahead with God’s help.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo  tiene 32 años, casada  tiene dos hijos que tienen la edad de 12 y 1 años, el vive en localidad de batallas, el se dedica  al servicio de transporte público desde hace ya varios años,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Hugo  utilizara este préstamo para el mantenimiento y compra de un motor para su vehículo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital ya que este vehículo es su único medio de trabajo y con los ingresos que genera mantiene a su familia el Sr. Hugo  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Hugo is 32 years old and has two children, ages 12 and 1 and lives in Batallas.  He provides public transportation and has been doing so for several years.  This will be his first loan through the institution and Hugo will use it to perform maintenance on his vehicle motor.  He lacks working capital and this vehicle is his only means of work and he supports his family with the income.  Hugo is grateful to the institution for its help.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Aptakan

texts.ru: Аптакан 41 год, замужем, у нее 4 дочери. В 1989 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Аптакан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день, в ее товарообороте имеется 2 лошади, 1 корова, 2 теленка и 5 овец, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аптакан обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение хозяйства за счет покупки  коров с телятами. В будущем, Аптакан хочет увеличить свой бизнес и расширить хозяйство. Для того чтобы иметь возможность  обучить дочку в Университете.
texts.en:
Aptakan is 41-year-old married mother of four. In 1989, as she was searching for a new source of income for her family, Aptakan began her own animal husbandry business with 5,000 som. Thanks to persistence and perseverance, she now has two horses, one cow, two calves, and five sheep for trade. Her monthly profit is about 8,000 som. 

With long-term business development in mind, Aptakan turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 70,000 som loan that will help her expand her farm by purchasing cows together with their calves. In the future, Aptakan hopes to expand her farm even more so that she will have the ability to give her daughter a university education.

loans.use: To purchase cows and calves

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 29 лет, замужем. У них с мужем замечательный сынишка 10 лет. Он учится в школе, но в свободное от учебы время он помогает маме.Образование у Айгуль среднее, после окончания школы помогала родителям и вышла замуж.По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный, целеустремленный. Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Айгуль её бизнес очень хорошо развивается. Она занимается откормом и последующей реализацией скота. По мимо этого она занимается продажей молока. Начав этот бизнес в 2010 году с 20,000 KGS сейчас у неё имеется 5 голов овец,1 корова. Ежемесячный доход Айгуль составляет 3,600 KGS Сом от продажи молока. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 40,000 KGS сом.Это её третье обращение в компанию "Бай Тушум и Партнеры". На полученные средства она собирается закупить 1 корову. Купив 1 корову она сможет увеличить доход от продажи молока. Айгуль поделилась с нами что в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Aigul is a 29-year-old married woman. She and her husband have a wonderful 10-year-old son. He is in school, but in his free time he helps his mother. Aigul has a high school education. After high school, she helped her parents and got married. She is a good, quiet, dedicated person. 

Thanks to Aigul's effort and hard work, her business is developing very well. She feeds cattle for future sale. Similarly, she sells milk. She began the business in 2010 with 20,000 som and today she has five sheep and one cow. Her monthly income from milk sales is 3,600 som. 

Aigul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 40,000 som loan. This is her third time coming to Bai Tushum and Partners. Upon receiving a loan, she plans to purchase one cow, which will allow her to increase her milk sales. Aigul shared with us that in the future she plans to renovate her home and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она очень шустрая и мотивированная девушка. Однажды она прочла рекламу о курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и захотела участвовать в нем. Она как всегда была активна в реализации новой цели. Ее новая цель была организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует помочь родителям для  улучшения условия проживания. У нее много целей будущим и она стремится реализовать их. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnora in a hardworking 22-year-old girl. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. She is very bright and motivated. 

One day Gulnora read an advertisement for the course "Bring It On", which is organized by the Business Women's Association, and wanted to sign up. Like always, she was very active in reaching her new goal - to successfully start her own business. She completed the course "Bring It On" and received a certificate. Now she is fully capable of successfully starting her own business. 

Gulnora would like to start a cattle trade business because she has experience in that line of work. With the income from her business, she plans to help her parents improve their standard of living. Gulnora has many goals for the future and she is striving to achieve them. She is requesting a 600 U.S. dollar loan to purchase cattle to start her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been farming rice  for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a fighter who lives in her own house with her husband and children. She has made a living with a store for one year. The store is located in her home, which she adapted so it's attractive to her customers. Her neighbors recommend her for both her work and her character. She's very well known and preferred because she's a very kind and hardworking woman who has earned the trust of her neighbors. Aisha's husband is a driver and together they contribute to the welfare of the family.

Her greatest desire is to continue earning income from her business, which up to now has helped her cover most of her household needs. This is why she decided to request this loan, with the goal of increasing her inventory because she doesn't have enough resources to make this investment on her own.

The loan she's requesting from Yehu is to buy a variety of store products such as oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, beverages, flour, etc. She hopes to get a greater share of the market, which will allow her to increase her income and give her family better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of store products such as oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, beverages, flour, etc.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en: Tai is 36 years old and married with 1 child. She would like to start a small business, selling puletasi (traditional Samoan women's clothing), dresses, and t-shirts. In order to do this, Tai needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread, material, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy needles, a sewing machine, scissors, thread, material, etc..

loans.name: Valintina

texts.en:
Valintina works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a frozen products business in the Philippines.

Valintina requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Valintina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
For more than ten years in Balili, Kapatagan, Erlinda, a 57-year-old married mother of 8 children, has made a living by operating a general store that sells a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Recently, Erlinda joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soap, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk) shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a 21-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells barbecue in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Jessica needs a loan to buy meat and barbecue equipment. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Jessica has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, chicken, sausages and mutton flaps

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en: Asiasiga is a 59-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, yam and banana to earn a living. Asiasiga has requested a loan to buy equipment such as knives, knapsack spray, spades, gloves and chemicals for her business. She will spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as knives, chemicals, knapsack spray, spades and gloves.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 35 years old.  She describes herself as happy, hard-working and responsible with her children.  She lives with her husband and their four children in the town of Samburu located in the province of Coast.

Joyce has a grocery store which is located in her home.  It is the main store in her area.  For this reason, she constantly needs to supply her store with products.  This is her first loan with Yehu.  The loan will be invested in the purchase of wholesale groceries like rice, sugar, salt and potatoes as well as canned goods, soft drinks and other things that will allow her customers to have more variety.  By doing this, she will be able to obtain good earnings and improve her quality of life.

Joyce dreams that they will continue to support her with loans so that she can continue to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, salt and potatoes as well as canned goods, soft drinks and other things for her grocery store.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 38 year old business man who lives in Yei,  He is married with 5 children between the ages of 4 and 14.  All of them go to school.  

Juma runs a clothing store, and has been in business for 6 years.  He has no employees.  He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers.  He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more clothes,  Besides this business, he has no other source of Income.

In 5 years Juma would like to expand his business and open other branches.  His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.  Juma says he is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items like clothes, etc

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms Naseem is 37 years old and a mother of three children.  For 3 years, she has been running a business of milk sales.  She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family.  Her husband is working in factory as a laborer.  With the passage of time her sales have increased and also her income.  Now she has two buffaloes and one cow.  This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home.  She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters.  While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Vanila

texts.en:
Vanila is 50 years old and married with 6 children.  She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yam and taaamu that she can sell in her community or at the market.  She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Vanila needs a loan to buy spray, knives, spade, chemicals, gloves, axe,etc.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.  Vanila will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, knives, spade, chemicals, gloves, axe,etc...

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 38 years old.  She and her husband are in a common-law relationship and they have six children.  Eunice and her family reside in a community in the town of Samburu.

Eunice started her grocery business five years ago.  She sells home products such as flour, basic grains, cleaning products, etc.  She was motivated to establish her business so that she could help her husband with the family expenses.

She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of KES 40,000.  Eunice plans to invest the money in the purchase of more products such as rice, sugar, flour,detergents, medicines, soft drinks, condiments, toilet paper, and snacks.

She believes the loan will be helpful because it will help her to maintain the inventory in her business and allow her to offer better service to her customers

loans.use: to purchase of more products such as rice, sugar, flour, detergents, medicines, soft drinks, condiments, toilet paper, and snacks.

loans.name: Fasifaalua

texts.en:
Fasifaalua is 28 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns and operates a sewing business for her community.  She has 3 years of experience in this line of business.  

Fasifaalua needs a loan to buy her new sewing machine and other equipment that she needs.  She hopes to use her profits to help support her family in all needs.  She joined SPBD in 2012

loans.use: new sewing machine, needles, threads,

loans.name: Anastalinn

texts.en:
Anastalin is a 25 year old married woman with 3 children.  She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living.  She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Anastalin needs a loan to buy her flour, sugar, baking powder, a new gas burner, etc.  She plans to use her profits to provide financial support to her family and to send her kids to school.  Anastalin has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: flour, sugar, cooking oil, cooking pot.

loans.name: Rayneldo

texts.en:
Rayneldo is a widow with 4 children.  Rayneldo is 49 -years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Rayneldo is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 5 years and every month he earn 6,000 PHP from this work.  He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair the existing vehicle for better service.

Rayneldo is a new member of GDMPC.  In the future Rayneldo hopes to finish educating his children and to gain double income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Ms Zaitoon is 30-years-old, an active and married woman.  She is effectively doing a business of hand-embroidery at her home for the last 9 years.  Her collection is very famous in her town.  She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members.  She makes enough to lead a decent life while her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet everyday expenditures of household.  Her husband is working a molding machines as a laborer. 

She is a loving mother of four children.  She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education.  She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation.  Now she requested for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase stocks of threads and packs of sequins, glitters, etc. in different colors to complete customers' orders on time.  She expects more profits and hence better support her family. She desires to spend part of the income on providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads and packs of sequins, glitters, etc. in different colors to complete customers' orders on time.

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is a married woman with two children from Talibon, Bohol, in the Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business for 20 years together with her husband. This is her only source of income.

Meraluna is requesting a loan to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. Through this loan, her boat will be well-equipped when she goes fishing. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and making it profitable so that she can buy what her family needs and also pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for fishing

loans.name: Elly Issa

texts.en:
Elly is a 36-year-old businessman who lives in Yei, South Sudan. He is married with 5 children between the ages of 4 and 14. All of them go to school. Elly runs a clothing store and has been in business for 6 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4000 SSP to purchase more clothes and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of Income.

In 5 years, Elly would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Elly says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia  is a 37-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She runs a business selling general goods and products in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Leonia has requested a loan to help her increase the quality of her business. She plans to use her profits to support her kids' education and also her family's living conditions. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, candies, rice, sugar, and tined fish.

loans.name: Usub

texts.en:
Usub is 64 years old and lives in Artamet village, in the Armavir region of Armenia, with his wife. Both of them are of retirement age. Usub is involved in cattle breeding and he keeps ten cows and 300 lambs. His wife uses the milk they produce in cheese production and Usub sells it in the local market. Additionally, he provides beef to local butchers. He is a very hard-working man and does his best to ensure that he enjoys good sales. 

Usub has requested a loan to purchase three oxen and fifteen lambs in order to expand his business. This will increase the family income so they will be able to improve their living conditions. Usub awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and fifteen lambs

loans.name: Muia

texts.en: Muia is a 66-year-old married woman with 8 children. She makes and sells popcorn in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Muia needs a loan to help her provide good quality in her business. She plans to use her profits to help support her family and her kids' education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, cooking oil, butter, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ramez

texts.en:
Ramez is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon, and is the father of three children. He owns a Housewares Maintenance Shop. 

Ramez is a Syrian citizen with 20 years of experience in his domain. He works in Lebanon to provide his family with a better living. He is well known in his surroundings for his good reputation and morals. He devotes his life to his family and works hard to provide them with a better financial living. For this reason he is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to better support his business.

With the requested loan capital, Ramez will be able to purchase spare parts for appliances he repairs, which he needs a lot in his business, and they will help a lot in improving both his social and financial situations in a well-managed way. Ramez is planning to expand and improve his business as much as he can to keep a good heritage for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Peti

texts.en:
Peti is 26 years old and married with no children. She has a small garden where she grows taros and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

She needs a loan to supply new tools and equipment to improve her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Peti will use the profits from her sales to provide good financial support for her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovels, fertilizer, chemicals, weed killer, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gastav

texts.en: Gastav is a 29-year-old woman with no children. She makes and sells coffee, lite foods and bakery products from her canteen to her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. She needs a loan to provide good quality in her business. She plans to use her profits to help support her family. Gastav has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a coffeemaker, flour, cooking oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Elisa has requested a loan to buy more knives, knapsack spray, filings, wheelbarrow, etc. to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy knives, chemicals, knapsack spray, filings, wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is 31 years old and the mother of three children. One of her daughters is shown in the photo, standing with Razia. For 20 years, Razia has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is a married woman with four grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in her fishing business for 20 years now, together with her husband. She earns about 15,000 Php monthly. This is the source of her income.

She is requesting a loan to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for her boat. Through this loan, she will be able to manage her boat properly while fishing in the middle of the sea.

In the future, Emeliana dreams of expanding her business to gain more profit. She wants to buy an additional boat for more income.

loans.use: to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Kholood

texts.en: Kholood is 36 years old and is from Gaza. She is married and has 6 children, three of whom go to school. She has owned a small grocery store since 2009. She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more food and to install display shelves. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and thus improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more food and to install display shelves.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 28-year-old married woman. It has been 10 years now since she got married and now she has three kids. A few years ago she started a small home business, selling food products and snacks. Now she has separated her business from her home and opened her own mini market. She has applied for this youth loan to get more goods for the store to increase her profits, and to be able to provide the customers with almost everything they want.

loans.use: to get more goods for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for shoes and materials for his shoe business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, a 22-year-old single guy living with his six  younger siblings. Ahmad has a clothing sales business with which he is supporting himself; he also helps his family to pay some of the household bills. Now, Ahmad has applied for a youth loan in order to purchase a new winter clothing collection.

loans.use: to buy a new winter clothing collection.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Lkhagvasuren, 62 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a manager in a nongovernmental organization since 1999. Aside from work, she has a hobby of planting flowers, and she teaches alcohol-addicted people how to plant flowers in the summer time. In order to plant flowers, she needs some capital. So she is requesting the loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy seeds, pots and fertilizer. 

Lkhagvasuren's work is very beneficial to environmental protection. According to Project Green, plants help to remove pollutants from the air. During the process of photosynthesis, the flowering plants' leaves absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen. Additionally, the roots of flowering plants can help to hold soil in its proper place, reducing erosion and flooding.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pots and fertilizer

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en:
Zahi is a 34-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has worked in a gypsum board decoration business for twenty years. He started working when he was only 14 in order to make his own living. He was able to get only his intermediate studies.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary requested tools for his business. His clients are his neighbors, relatives and friends. They all agree on his talent in his work, his perfection and honesty.
 
This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His first loan helped him a lot in improving his social and financial situations. Zahi is working hard to improve his living for a better business and for future social living. He hopes to expand his business as much as he can and to hire someone to help him reply to extra requests that he isn't capable of doing at the moment.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 27 years old and married, but she is not yet blessed with any child. She is very responsible and lives with her husband in the coastal region of Kenya. Deborah has a posho mill (cereal grain grinding machine). In addition, she also sells dried maize. She says that some of her customers who buy her dried maize need the services of her posho mill, because they at times require flour out of the maize they purchase. She has had her business for two years. It’s gone well and is very well-known.

She is asking for a loan so that she can buy more sacks of maize to resell. She sells in quantity and in small amounts, and the maize bought with the loan will allow her to count on a large number of sales. Deborah wants to improve her earnings so that she can continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize to resell.

loans.name: Redab

texts.en: Redab is a 28-year-old single lady. She is the oldest of 6 sisters and one brother. She did not get a chance to get a higher education after high school, so two years ago Redab started a small home business selling home and kitchen appliances to be able to help the family. She also wants to help her sisters and brother to get the highest level of education they can get. Now, Redab has applied for a youth loan to increase her inventory of home appliances.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of home appliances.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 22, is from Gaza.

He has owned a grocery store since March 2011.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy one refrigerator for drinks, another for ice cream, and more goods for his grocery store.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy one refrigerator for drinks, another for ice cream, and more goods for his grocery store.
