loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en: Batsukh, 58, lives with his family in Darkhan, second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own apartment. His elder son is under a disability grant and his daughter, 27, teaches the Russian language at secondary high school; both he and his wife get retirement benefits. Also, his daughter sells clothes and based on her business experience, he began to sell clothes at retail; sometimes puts the products on other people’s counter temporarily. In future, he wants to purchase his own counter. He is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to increase his current assets. As a result, his business will expand, which will have positive effects on regional economic prosperity because medium and small business entities are the cornerstone of microeconomic development.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en: Yasmin, a 21-year-old conservative lady, asked her dad to appear in the photo in her place. Yasmin is now back living with her parents, after she got a divorce. Her father works in selling detergents and tissues to different shops and houses, in the city where they live, using a distributing bus. Yasmin wanted to help her father. So she applied for a youth loan, part of which she will use to get more goods for her father to sell.  She will use the other part of the loan to buy some kitchen appliances that she can sell at home, to housewives in their neighborhood.

loans.use: to get more goods for her father to sell, and some kitchen appliances that she will sell from home.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam, a 23-year-old housewife, is a mother of a 2-year-old son and a 1-year-old son. Recently Maryam started a a small home business selling blankets and bed covers while her husband is on duty with the military. Now, Maryam has applied to a youth loan to increase her inventory, for demand has gotten higher because of cold winter weather.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of blankets and bed covers.

loans.name: Siamini

texts.en:
Siamini is 31 years old and is the young mother of two children. She is a very responsible and hardworking mother, who lives with her family in the rural area of Mwambalazi. Siamini has a small fruit-selling business outside the market; she sells coconuts. She has had this business for four years. She also has a general store in her home. She also raises some livestock, and she attends to her animals during her free time.

Siamini wants to stock her coconut-selling business, but she does not have enough working capital. Therefore she is asking for a loan in the amount of KES 40,000 to buy more stock of coconuts to resell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonjargal, 34 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a security guard in a market since 2011. He works a 24-hour shift, followed by 48 hours off. And during his day off, he renders taxi service to local people. 

His house has been heavily damaged over the years, and as winter comes to Mongolia, the wind is blowing hard and chilling the family to its core. So he is requesting the loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy insulating and construction materials. As a result of repairs and insulation, the family will live in a comfortable place, while burning less fuel for heat. This will contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to buy insulating and construction materials, to weather-proof and repair his family's house.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal, 23, lives with his parents and three siblings in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house. His parents are retired from work. His sister, 43, works as a waitress in a restaurant, and his younger brother and sister both go to university and high school, respectively. 

In April of 2012 he began working as an electrician. Because the place where he works is very far away from home and he picks up his younger brother from university, he needs a quality automobile. Therefore, he is requesting the loan of 6800000 MNT to buy a new automobile which is environmentally friendly. As a result, the family can spare invest money in a taxi service and generate more. Also, the car emits less smoke, which will contribute to efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy a new automobile.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon; he is the father of three children. He has worked in a transportation for four years. This is his only source of income--that's why he has to keep on working hard to make sure he receives the best income every day.

The bus is rented. That's why he has to put in a lot more effort to make sure that he is capable of covering almost all of his needs.

He is well known by his good manners and discipline in dealing with customers.

He is applying a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on the van to keep it in a good situation as much as he can to cover all of his family's needs.

He will also make necessary repairs to his home by pasting tiles to his floor.

Ali wants to buy his own van for in the future and increase his income instead of spending part of it on rent.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Zakariyya

texts.en:
Zakariyya, 36, is from Gaza. He is married and has 4 children, two of whom go to school. He has owned a grocery store since 2009.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy refrigerators and more goods for the store. His ultimate ambition is to enlarge his shop and become a supermarket. He hopes that this loan will help him approach his ambition and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators and more goods for the store.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime has been engaged in coconut selling for 10 years. She is a 43-year-old married woman and has five children. She started her business with very little capital; thanks to her efforts and determination, she can now buy coconuts in large quantity. She sells them door-to-door. 

She wants to increase her business and have more income from it so that she can open a retail shop. Mwatime is asking for 30,000 KES to buy more sacks of coconuts for sell.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconuts for sell.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 37-year-old, conservative woman, so she asked her husband to appear in the photo in her place. Maha has two girls and two boys, whose ages are 16, 15, 13, and 9. Her husband works in a private company, while she sells women’s garments, called “Abaya,” at home. For now Maha only brings and sells Abayas by order, because she orders them from another country by piece. She has applied for this loan to buy and bring in a collection to have as inventory, so she can have a variety of garments to show and sell to her customers. She would love to open her own store in the future, for selling different types of Abaya and traditional dresses.

loans.use: to stock a collection of the women's garments called "abaya," to have as inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 34 years old from Gaza. He is married and has three girls.

He has owned a grocery store since 2011.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy shelves, stands, an electricity generator, and a display fridge.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy shelves, stands, an electricity generator, and a display fridge.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman, and a responsible mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver, but his income is inadequate to fulfill the household needs. She is facing a very difficult time. Shazia, herself, is a tailor by profession and works eight hours a day with full dedication. In spite of working full time, she takes care of all the housework and makes sure that she can fulfill all of her children's needs. All of the income which comes from her tailoring business goes to the household expenses, on account of which she is unable to save any amount for her children’s future. 

Shazia, as a member of this three-person borrowing group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase fabric and a sewing machine for her tailoring business. (Currently, she has only one sewing machine, which she uses for personal use as well as for her tailoring business.) This loan will help her to increase her net income. Shazia hopes that the loan will be beneficial to them.

Note: In the picture, Shazia holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabric for her tailoring business

loans.name: Dzombo

texts.en: Dzombo is a determined man with the desire to move forward. He is asking for another loan to expand his business. The previous loan helped him improve his living standards and at the same time increase his business. He is asking for this loan to buy more goats and cows to resell. His dream is to have a rental house.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows to resell

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

Parveen is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fish-selling business for several years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Virginia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Virginia has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 36-year-old married woman who has two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a school bus driver. Raeda started a business by taking over a school's cafeteria. She brings in snacks and food that the children at school eat. 

Raeda has applied for this loan so she can buy new types of snacks of better quality. In the future, she would like to do the same for more schools and establish a cafeteria contracting business.

loans.use: to buy new types of snacks of better quality.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 30 years old and is from Gaza. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. He financially helps his parents as well.

Since 2008, Sulaiman has owned a shop where he sells and services mobile phones.

He has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more mobile phones and accessories as well as an air conditioner.

Sulaiman hopes that this loan will help him increase his customer base and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and accessories as well as an air conditioner.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 37-year-old married man who has two sons and one daughter. Ali supports his family through the school and office supplies shop that he owns. He also sells toys and other items that can be gifted between kids for birthdays.

Ali has applied for this loan to buy more stationary products and other school supplies for students and teachers.

loans.use: to buy more stationary products and school supplies.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Mr. Baasansuren, age 39, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He worked as a contract worker in Korea from 2007 to 2010. In 2012, he began selling clothes. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy clothes and furniture. In doing so, his business will expand and he will generate more income. This will enable him to invest in his son’s future education. 

In the future, Mr. Baasansuren would like to increase his customer base.

loans.use: to buy clothes and furniture.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married to Hassan and has three children, two of school age. 

She sells coconuts wholesale from her home. As her sales increase, they generate more income for her. With her husband’s and children’s help, and much effort and sacrifice, they’re all getting ahead in life. She says that her work requires lots of effort and she does it all so that she can provide a better future for her children and so that they don’t have to face the same challenges that she did.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy coconuts, which will help her meet her customers' demands. She is grateful to Yehu for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 36-year-old widow. She has been doing a business of milk sales for many years. In the beginning, she had only one buffalo, but gradually she has improved her business and now she has one cow and two buffaloes in milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She counts a good client list. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life.

She is a mother of six children, four daughter and two sons. Her sons also help in her business. 

This is her second loan and she has a strong association with Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy one more cow to increase milk production. In this way, she would be able to serve more people in her community. She wishes to use part of the revenue on her children’s better future.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 61-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in a food-vending business selling home-cooked foods to the people in her locality. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Veronica is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending like meat, seasonings and vegetables and to buy fuel for the fishing boat. With this, she will be able to cook more to serve and cater to her clients and customers in her eatery. Also her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch.

In the future, Veronica hopes to make a success of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending like meat, seasonings and vegetables and to buy fuel for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 17-year-old son in a neighborhood in the town of Mwambalazi, Kenya. 

A year ago, he began selling everyday consumer products such as salt, soap, rice, beans, corn, eggs, sugar, juices, and soft drinks.
 
With this loan of 15,000 KES that he is requesting from Yehu, Hamisi wants to grow his business by restocking it with more products. He plans to buy basic grains, salt, coffee, soap, detergent, eggs, flour, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, medicines, and other products. His goal is to build an adjoining room to his house so that he can relocate his business, which is currently set up in his living room. This will enable him to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, salt, coffee, soap, detergent, eggs, flour, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, medicines, and other products.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, 49, lives in the Congo Town community. She is married and a mother of three children between the ages of 12 and 24. They all live at home and are in school.

She is hardworking and has been managing her business for the past 14 years. She sells palm oil, rice, onions, vita, salt, cooking oil, and many other items. Hawa sells from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily. She received the initial capital from her husband to start in this business. She makes a profit when she sells. She uses some of the profit to buy more goods and help her husband with the expenses of the family. She uses a commercial vehicle to transport her goods to her business area. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, vita, onions and salt for the business. Her dream is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, vita, onion and salt for the business.

loans.name: Kingi

texts.en: Kingi is a visionary man with the urge to have a decent life. Since the previous loan, his living standards have greatly improved. With this new investment, he wants to buy more layers and chicken feed for his poultry business. His aim is to see his children become professionals. This way, he is sure to have them have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more layers and chicken feed for his poultry business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms Bushra is a 40-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three daughters and four sons. She tries hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.

She has had a carpet manufacturing business for the past 20 years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and she is famous for providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She also sews as a part time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family's needs and requirements effectively. 

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support she has received from Kashf Foundation. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. Her husband is not in good enough physical shape to be employed. She wishes to use part of her profits to improve her husband’s health.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Patila

texts.ru: Патила 48 лет, замужем. После распада Советского Союза, Патила  начала заниматься торговлей парфюмерной продукцией. Она начала работать помощником на рынке,после реализатором, затем открыла свое дело позже Патила сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 15,000 сом. В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Патила обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Патила  планирует вложить часть доходов в образование сына, часть – в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Patila is 48 years old and married. After the fall of the Soviet Union, she began to work in the area of retail of perfume products. She started out as an assistant at the market, later worked as a salesperson, and finally opened her own business. She has successfully developed her business which now brings in monthly earnings of approximately 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som. In order to expand the range of goods she offers, Patila has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS.) She plans to use part of the income generated by this loan to pay for her son's education, and part to further increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.use: To buy more goods for retail

loans.name: Ngalaa

texts.en:
Ngalaa lives with his life companion and their children in their own house. He has a store where he sells basic products such as foods, milk, bread, and soap, among other items. The store is located in his home in a busy area. He has had his little business for a number of years, and this has given him a lot of experience in sales, which allows him to achieve very good earnings and has given him a lot of customers. People prefer him because everything that he sells is of first quality at affordable prices and, above all, with excellent service. 

Ngalaa is an entrepreneurial man, dedicated to his work. He is always looking for options that will give him a more prosperous future. For this reason, he strives to the maximum day after day to reach his goal. 

In recent weeks demand has increased, and he wants to make a new investment but he doesn't have sufficient capital. For this reason he is applying to Yehu for a loan that will allow him to buy basic foods, instant products, candies, bread, beverages, etc. 

Ngalaa has good payment references and is very responsible. He confirms that he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time he has faith that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic foods, instant products, candies, bread, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Rulabiem

texts.en:
Rulabiem is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She is engaged in seaweed farming business for several years now together with her husband.

Rulabiem is asking for a loan to buy materials for seaweed farming like seaweed seedlings, rope, sticks and straw.

In the future, Rulabiem hopes to make her business a success and to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming like seaweed seedlings, rope, sticks and straw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu, 32, lives in the Congo Town community. She is married and a mother of three children, who are between the ages of 3 and 14 and attend school. 

Bindu has been determined with her business for the past three years, She sells children's slippers and ladies' slippers. Bindu started with a little amount of 3,000 LD that she had been saving with a savings club. She learned to sell from her husband, and  she sells twelve hours a day.

Bindu has commended the lenders for their support of her business; they have empowered her to improve her business.  She makes a profit when she sells, and she uses the profit to buy more goods to increase her income.  She has requested a loan to purchase more ladies' and children's slippers for the business. Her future plan is to give her children a high level of education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' and children's slippers for the business.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married, and has no children. Moustafa is the only provider of the family. He is a barber. He established his business in 2010. He built a good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Moustafa is requesting a loan sum of $2,400, to renovate his shop and to buy a new air conditioner. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to buy a new air conditioner

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa, who appears in the picture, is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of five sons. Alaa's husband is a school teacher who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs and his sons' education expenses.

For the past five years, Alaa has been making traditional foods, pastries and sweets in her home, to sell to her customers upon their request. Alaa's project has been a profitable one and a second, helper source of income to the family. Her business also needs more support to cover its costs.

Alaa is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new oven. Taking this loan will enable Alaa to grill her pastries and sweets in less time, and to provide her customers with high quality. This will increase customers' demand, increasing Alaa's sales and improving the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven for making traditional foods, pastries and sweets.

loans.name: Sayyad

texts.en:
Sayyad is a exemplary husband, father of three children and most important in business, hardworking and a good farmer. He has been working with fattening livestock for around 18 years.He has several livestock at his home; he sells yearling sheep and wool to the neighbors and also at the market.
 
Sayyad wants to obtain a loan of 600 AZN for home repair. After the repair, from the income of business he plans to buy home furniture gradually. For his business in future, he plans to increase the number of animals and purchase pasture for them.  

After having repaid his previous loan, he decided to take another one. He has collaborated with our organization for a period of two years and hopes for further collaboration and support.

loans.use: to finance his home repair.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is a 39-year-old mother of two children. She works at a local shop and gets  a monthly salary. Gohar's elder son studies at Yerevan Medical College "Erebuni" in the dental department. Together with her husband, Gohar works hard in order to sustain the family, but unfortunately their salaries don't allow them to pay for their son's education. So, Gohar has applied for this loan to pay the tuition. The loan will help her son to complete his education in college and apply for the university.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition

loans.name: Marvis

texts.en:
Marvis is 54 years, a single parent taking care of two children and his elderly mother.  He is an individual member of the Universal group which meets on Mondays.


He has been trading in materials for the past eight years. He gets his goods from the market on a large scale and in turn sells to both individuals and organizations. This, according to him, has helped him to educate his children to the high school level. He is very dedicated, industrious and very hardworking.

He also sews both male and female attire. 


This is his 5th loan which he is requesting for an amount of GHC 1,000 to help him buy more materials to sell to his customers and to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more materials and sell to customers.

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en: Fuzuli is 41 years old, married with two children. He began his barber business 17 years ago, and today he has his own clientele. Also he has been engaged with animal husbandry to improve his family income. Thanks to the help and money that he has applied for, he will be able to buy sheep and make improvements in his stall for animals. This way, he will be able to provide for security and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To buy sheep and make improvements in his stall for the animals.

loans.name: Tarikh

texts.en:
Tarikh is 54 years old and married. His wife works at the hospital, as a nurse. Tarikh and his wife have three sons. Tarikh works raising livestock and growing crops, having learned this work from his father. He buys and sells grazing cattle, and he sells milk products, at home and at a local market. Also, he rents out his agrimotor, to earn additional income for his family. 

Currently, Tarikh wants to buy two cattle. He has requested the loan so he can make this purchase, raise the cattle and resell them. His work helps him to meet his family's needs, and this loan will help him increase his inventory and earn higher income.

loans.use: To purchase two head of cattle and earn higher income.

loans.name: James E.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers from Waterloo, a small town near Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown. These teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 9,000,000 SLL for the entire team in order to solve their immediate financial needs. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Amadu is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Moyamba district, in southern Sierra Leone, the sexagenarian is married with six children. A very resilient and knowledge-loving man, Amadu has requested this loan in order to finance his education in a higher institution of learning.

loans.use: to finance his education in a higher institution of learning

loans.name: Marthline

texts.en:
Marthline 37, married, with four children, resides with her husband in Congo Town. For the past three years, Marthline has been working hard to manage her business. She sells rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, onions, and tomatoes at the community market. She sells eleven hours per day.  

Because of her good relationship with customers, she makes a profit when she sells. She uses some of the profit to buy more goods to improve the business and to help with the expenses of the home. Her goods are being transported to the market by commercial vehicle. 

She thanks the lenders for their support towards her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more pepper, salt, rice, and palm oil, for the business. She hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt, rice, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon, the father of two children. He is a school bus driver known for his patience and cautiousness in treating the students.

He has a big responsibility in his business, since he is dealing with a lot of family's children and he has to make sure that everything is going fine with his bus and his health at the same time, because most parents rely on him for their children's safety.

Rabih is optimistic and he works hard to meet his children's needs.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his children's school fees and stationery, in addition to buying diesel (heating) necessary for his family to warm up in the coming autumn-winter season, in additon to the necessary and mouneh (stored food to be consumed during the rough winter season).

This is his second loan as Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing repayment history.

Rabih is planning to buy another bus to expand his working zone, and increase his income.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 46-year-old mother of three children. She lives in Aygestan village of the Ararat region with her family. Her husband and elder son work out of the country and provide financial assistance to the family. Ruzanna is involved in agriculture. She breeds cattle, and has a plot of land where peach, pear, apple and apricot trees are grown. As her husband's work is seasonal, agriculture helps Ruzanna to have stable income all year.

She has requested a loan for purchasing 15 lambs and expanding her agricultural business. Additional money will be used in renovation of the barn, which is too old and uncomfortable for breeding cattle. This will enable Ruzanna to ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 15 lambs and renovation of her barn

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya where she lives with husband and five children who are all in school. She has been in farming for ten years and currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand with milk, eggs and maize being her main produce for the local market.

Rosemary has requested a loan of 62,400 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She plans to have a dairy farm of five cows and rank among the major milk suppliers for the local markets. She says the sale of her milk produce will help improve the living standards of her family.

Rosemary notes animal feeds shortage remains the major challenge especially with dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is a 46-year-old dressmaker from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children ages 23, 22, 19, nine and seven years old. 

Wilfreda is asking for a loan to buy  more cloth, needles, thread and other sewing materials. With this, she will be able make more dresses and do repairs from her clients.
 
In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy  more cloth, needles, thread and other sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and buy more poultry.

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi is a 54-year-old man. He is married and a father to six sons and four daughters. Fawzi has a farm planted with olive trees, but the income he gets from selling his olive crop is low and not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past five years, Fawzi has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the second source of income for the family.

Fawzi is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing and insuring the taxi he drives. This will enable Fawzi to travel legally and safely from one area to another and take additional internal and external requests,  which will improve the family's income.

Fawzi is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To license and insure the taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohamed M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group (Mohamed M.'s Group) of secondary school teachers from Waterloo, a small town near Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown. These teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 7,500,000 SLL for the entire team in order to solve their immediate financial needs. 

At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Michael is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Kono district in eastern Sierra Leone, the 40 year old is married to a nurse and the couple has one child. Michael has served in the teaching profession for many years. He has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture.

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his son appears in his Kiva profile photo.

Ghaleb is a 57-year-old married man, a father to three sons and two daughters. He is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. Ghaleb's son is a university student specializing in Engineering who wants to complete his studies, so Ghaleb is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help his son cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ghaleb's son to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Ghaleb's son and improve the family's living conditions. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 67 años de edad, vive en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde tiene un negocio desde el año 1997, el cual inició al recibir su liquidación, después de haber sido empleado de una empresa. Inicialmente vendió frutas, por unidades, y fue agregando queso, carne, de cerdo, suero, mantequilla y tubérculos varios, como hoy lo hace. Sus ventas las realiza de contado de lunes a domingo, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde. Carlos compra a proveedores de grandes abastos de contado. Aunque su negocio poco a poco ha ido creciendo, el volumen de compras que puede hacer, aun no es suficiente para satisfacer la demanda, pues tiene el gran desafío de no contar con el capital de trabajo requerido para comprar en mayor cantidad, lo cual le permitiría lograr precios mas competitivos y responder a su potencial clientela, especialmente en la temporada que se acerca, la navidad y el recibimiento del año nuevo, donde el consumo de alimentos se incrementa y Carlos justamente vende lo que usualmente en su mercado, los clientes usan como insumos para hacer el delicioso sancocho trifásico, un caldo, en el que se hierven o cuecen con tres tipos de, carnes de cerdo, res y gallina yuca, plátano, ñame, ahuyama, verduras,  y que es usual en las fiestas, para ser consumidas después de tomar licores que causan  la resaca del siguiente día. En la actualidad Carlos está aplicando al segundo financiamiento que hace a él, la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual logró tener más capital de trabajo, para aumentar sus inventarios y así mismo su clientela. Hoy está aplicando a su primer cedikiva, para comprar en mayor volumen, carnes de cerdo, res y gallina yuca, plátano, ñame, ahuyama, verduras y hacer su mejor venta, en la época que se aproxima, por lo cual espera convertirlo en una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 67 years old and lives in a community very near Barranquilla, where he has had a business since 1997.  He began it after he lost his job at another company.  At first he sold individual fruit but then added cheese, meat, whey, butter, and various types of tubers.  He sells for cash, Monday through Friday from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm and buys his wares for cash from large suppliers.  Even though his business has been growing little by little in size, the volume of goods that he can buy is not sufficient to satisfy the demand.  He has the great challenge of not having the working capital he needs to make purchases in quantity, which would provide him with more competitive prices and allow him to respond to potential customers, especially during the holiday season, when the consumption of food increases.

Carlos sells what he usually sells in his market.  Customers buy ingredients to make delicious soup that they boil and add three types of meat, pork, beef, and chicken; plantain, smoked yam, and vegetables.  It’s eaten at parties after drinking liquor.

Carlos is asking for another loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that he will use to increase his working capital and investments and number of customers.  He is using his first Kiva loan to buy pork, beef, chicken, yucca, plantains, etc. in bulk to improve his sales for the coming season.  He expects this to be a successful investment.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La fabricación artesanal de amasijos de maíz envueltos en hojas de esta misma planta o bollos y la elaboración de productos fritos, es el negocio de Ana Maria, una mujer de 64 años casada y madre de 8 hijos en edades adultas. Ella tiene 30 años de experiencia en esta actividad, con la cual ha generado ingresos para el sustento de su familia, pues desde joven, la aprendió de sus padres   y a ella se ha dedicado con mucho entusiasmo, mientas su cónyuge es conductor de un taxi de servicio público y unidos aportan ingresos, para lograr el bienestar de su hogar. Sus principales productos son los bollos de queso y los productos fritos, como empanadas, arepas de maíz, carimañolas y buñuelos,  los cuales vende en tiendas aledañas y de contado, desde los lunes hasta los sábados, en un horario de 6 dela mañana a 2 de la tarde. Gradualmente su negocio ha crecido, pues han sido aplicados 7 financiamientos, que le ha facilitado la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado ampliar sus ventas y estructurar una clientela, que la reconoce hoy en la zona donde está ubicada. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas, como maíz pilado, y un molino triturador eléctrico; con esta inversión ganará nuevos descuentos por compras en volumen y mejorará los tiempos productivos, con una herramienta de trabajo más moderna y nueva, que facilitará la agilidad en los procesos. Su meta más adelante es adquirir su propia casa y trabaja junto a su esposo esmeradamente, para lograr alcanzar este sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Ana Maria makes cakes out of corn dough wrapped in corn husks (bollos) and fried products.  She is 64 years old and the mother of eight adult children.  She has been doing this for 30 years and generates an income to support her family.  She learned this from her parents when she was young and does it with great enthusiasm, while her husband drives a taxi.  Together they bring in an income to support the household.  Her main products are cheese bollos and fried products such as empanadas, arepas, corn fritters and donuts, which she sells to surrounding stores from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm Monday through Saturday.  Her business has grown gradually and she has had seven loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which has also helped her expand her sales and customer base within her zone.

She is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can buy supplies such as dried corn and an electric mill.  This investment will allow her to get some discounts for buying in bulk and she will improve her production.  New and more modern work tools will make things easier.  Her goal is to have a home of her own in the future and to work alongside her husband to achieve her dream and prosper.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Agella's Group

texts.en:
Agella's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Agella is 19 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Agella has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dried fish. 

To help expand her business, Agella has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fish that will be sold, and will help Agella to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Agella hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Agella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy fish that will be sold

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is forty years old and lives with her life partner and children in their own home. She has a business where she sells fish; she has a few years of experience with her business which helps her increase her earnings. Mwajuma sells at the market. In addition, she also does farming, growing various crops. 

She is a very enterprising woman, dedicated to her job and is always looking for alternatives to give her better ways to be successful and is determined not to give up until she reaches her goal. The new investment will be used to increase her sales but in order to do that she needs capital and went to Yehu for a loan that will help her buy fish, cooking oil, and a frying pan.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. She has seven children.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business. She has been doing agricultural work for seven years.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Feeding poultry!" Her biggest challenge is: "Diseases and expensive poultry feeds." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Maua." Joyce stated that she will use the loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to buy more poultry birds.

Joyce was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because i wanted them to help me improve my life, because they give loans at a lower interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "They are short-term loans."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family," Joyce replied "I will be able to pay school fees for the children and household needs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joyce owns the following: cow, poultry, pump, bicycle, but does not own: pig, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: mosquito net, running water, sewing machine, TV, but does not have: electricity, solar power, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Machina's Group

texts.en:
Machina's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Machina is 17 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Machina has been working hard to manage her small farm, which rears goats and sells them. 

To help expand her business, Machina has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goats that will be sold, and will help Machina to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Machina hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Machina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more goats that will be sold.

loans.name: Ma-Jarka

texts.en:
Ma-Jarka, 40, lives in the west point community with her husband and four children. Her children are between the ages of 8 and 21, and are currently in school. Her husband is a driver. 

Ma-jarka has a cook shop (restaurant) in her community, where she has been selling food for the past three years. She prepares palm butter, cassava leaves, fufu (dumplings) and soup (made from cassava). She sells five days a week, eleven hours a day. With the good services rendered to her customers, she makes profit when she sells. With the profit generated from the business she buys more bags of rice and ingredients for the business, and assists her husband with the expenses of the family. She learned this way of selling from her sister. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more ingredients to increase her sales. Her plan is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to increase her sales.

loans.name: Aku

texts.en:
Aku is a 44 years old, a ready-made clothing seller. She is married to Bismark, a draftsman, who is 50 years old. She resides in Teshie with only her husband since their children are now living on their own.

She has been in this business for the past 12 years and is still doing very well. She has taken three loans already from ID. This is her fourth loan and she needs GHS 1,000 to expand her business and buy more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 48 years old and lives in Kareli district, with her son, daughter, daughter-in-law, an infant grandchild and her retired mother-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business and cultivates family-owned land, growing apple trees, haricot beans and onions. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. In addition, her daughter works as a teacher at the local school, and her son is a soldier. Both of them get monthly salaries. 

Marine requested a loan for starting up a trading business. Her loan requests were rejected each time, because she did not meet income requirements and she lacks experience in new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. But Marine’s loan request was approved by Credo, as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for business start-ups and re-startups. The program extends soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Marine will cover the costs of purchasing her initial inventory of basic groceries, for starting a grocery store. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Marine will work hard, and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. With this loan, her family will generate enough income to access regular, available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event they need it in the future.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan lives in Kutaisi District. She is 53 years old and a widow. She lives with her grown son. Ketevan is unemployed at the moment. The source of income for the family is the rental fee from the family-owned flat. Besides this, Ketevan’s son works as a guide at the tourist agency and gets a small monthly salary. 

Ketevan and her son decided to start their business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the received credit, Ketevan will purchase a car, and her son will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He started his career at a young age working in the construction field specifically as a painter. Twelve years of work has given him a lot of experience in this occupation and allowed him to becom very talented and qualified. He works on a freelance basis sticking with multiple projects. On overloaded days, a part-timer helps him complete the tasks. 

With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will improve his operations by renewing his tools. Hussein is very optimistic, ambitious and seeks the best. He has a future plan which consists of opening his own office as soon as possible in order to expand his business by dealing with construction entrepreneurs and gain higher income to better support his wife.

loans.use: to improve his operations by renewing his tools

loans.name: Mohamad Hussein

texts.en:
Mohamad Hussein is a 22-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife. In 2009, he decided to start his own business working as an electrician. He works upon customers requests and is accompanied with a part-timer working under his supervision whenever there is overwork to accomplish. 

Today, Mohamad Hussein is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car for his business. He states that the car will facilitate his transportation and allow him to serve more customers, especially since he will be able to expand his work geographically. This is his first Kiva loan and he is certain that he will be capable of achieving a remarkable growth in a short period after getting the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 24 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his wife and two infant children. Gocha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family's poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is a small agricultural business. They have a milk cow and 2 calves. The family produces cheese and sells locally. Their income is hardly enough for food for a four member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business and build a greenhouse. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the loan, Gocha will purchase all the building materials for the greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Gocha will grow greens and tomatoes. The harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 18 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. Judith's group is comprised of three hardworking women.

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more fashionable clothes to sell; this will help her to generate greater profits, pay for her medical expenses, and buy new clothes for herself. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: Hamda, a 20-year-old conservative lady, asked her mother to take her place in the photo. A single lady with six siblings, her oldest brother having recently joined the military, Hamda started a small home-based business selling blankets not too long ago. She is now requesting this youth loan in order to buy more blankets, bed covers and sheets.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bed covers.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: While her husband is serving in the military, 31-year-old Dalal looks after their two sons and their daughter; she also works in a clothing sales business that she recently started at home. Dala gets her goods at wholesale prices from various markets throughout Jordan, reselling them from her home to friends and neighbors at  reasonable prices. She is now requesting this loan to bring in a new winter collection of children's clothing.

loans.use: to bring in a new winter collection of children's clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” que conforman 10 socios trabajadores en distintas áreas de trabajo, que pasan al ciclo 03. Soledad tiene 31 años, conviviente y 02 hijos menores. Ella se dedica a la venta de llantería. Soledad comenta que a pesar de la competencia le  ha ido bien y eso la motiva a seguir trabajando. Con el crédito que solicitó comprará llantas y parches para su negocio. Su mayor deseo es de tener su casa propia ya que por el momento es alquilado. Esta agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por hacer realidad su progreso. Soledad se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás, es la tercera del lado izquierdo, viste chompa blanca. La señora de chompa celeste es la señora Romina, está ubicada adelante del lado derecho, es la mama de Jhenry que por motivos de estudios no pudo estar presente en la foto grupal.
texts.en:
This is the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" [Triumphant Women] Group, formed of ten hard-working members in different areas of work.  This is their third group cycle.  

Soledad is thirty-one years old and lives with her two young children.  She makes a living selling tire products.  Soledad says that despite the competition, her business has done well and this is her motivation to continue working.  

With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy tires and patches for her business.  Her greatest wish is to have her own home; she is currently renting.  She is thankful for the Kiva investors for helping her progress.

Soledad is standing in the last line, third from the left in the white sweater.  

The woman in the light blue sweater is Romina; she is located in the front row on the right.  She is the mother of Jhenry, and is standing in since he could not be present for the group photo because of school.

loans.use: to buy tires and tire repair patches

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in Khndzoresk village with his wife and son. He is involved in cattle breeding. In particular, he keeps 10 cows and also has a plot of land where he cultivates wheat, potatoes and barley. He works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local market. 

Because agriculture is the only source of income for this family, Garik would like to expand that business. He has applied for this loan, to use part of the money to purchase a milk cow. Garik will use the milk in cheese production, which will significantly increase his income. Garik will use the other part of the loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Garik, to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a milk cow, and forage for feeding the livestock during the winter.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Spandarian village, Syunik region, with her husband and 17-year-old son. She is involved in agriculture. She breeds cattle and cultivates barley, potatoes and wheat. Her husband works at local school and earns monthly income. But unfortunately, his income is not enough to cover the costs of the family. 

Hasmik has applied for the loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to cover some operational costs, and she will be able to pay for the family’s everyday living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Milena Patricia

texts.es: Milena de 31 años de edad tiene un pequeño negocio, en un municipio cercano a la ciudad, donde vende artículos de piñatería o productos especializados  para  fiestas, como globos, stikers y recipientes de icopor, los cuales vende de contado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 dela noche, en una frecuencia diaria.  Su negocio nació, pues su suegro le dio el apoyo en conocimientos debido a que  es un veterano  comerciante y también facilitó   mercancías, porque solo contaba  con un pequeño capital para lograr surtirlo. De esta manera su gran desafío era tener suficiente dinero, para invertirle e incrementar  las ventas de artículos con mayor rotación, por la fuerte demanda del sector. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y hoy las solicitudes de mercancias y el aumento de clientes, es su día a día, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, pues el final de año es una época de grandes celebraciones familiares y el capital resulta insuficiente, para responder a la demanda de su mercado. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará globos, tarjetas, piñatas, dulces, sobres y artículos  de consumo masivo, que hará que sus ingresos se incrementen, al lograr un aumento en sus ventas, producto del capital aplicado, que hacen de su credikiva una inversión de mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Milena is 31 years old and has a small business in a nearby town where she sells party supplies such as piñatas, balloons, strikers, and other things which she sells from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.  Her brother in law helped her start her business because he is a veteran merchant and helped her get merchandise because she only had a little capital. Her greatest challenge was to have enough money to invest and increase her sales of quick selling items given the high demand in her sector.  Little by little her business was growing and the increase in requests for merchandise and increased number of customers has prompted her to request a Kiva loan.

This will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use the money to buy balloons, cards, piñatas, candy, envelopes, and consumables. This will allow her income to increase as a result of increased sales and a good investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. She has seven children. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business. She has been doing this work for 15 years.

Justine stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keeping and dairy farming!" Her biggest challenges are animal diseases and expensive animal feed. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Seroi' and 'Lelmet.' 

Justine will use the loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.

Justine was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because it gives loans to small-scale farmers, so as to improve their lives."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "They are financial institutions that offer short-term loans."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Justine replied, "Money from the sale of poultry and its products will enable me to pay school fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Justine owns the following: a cow, poultry, a bicycle, and an automobile, but she does not own a pig, a pump or a motorcycle. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, a sewing machine, and a television, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 21 years old and lives in the town of Hima, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past three years Mary has been working hard to manage her salon, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more fashionable hair extensions. The loan will help Mary to generate greater profits, pay for her medical expenses, and buy new clothes for herself. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for herself. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more fashionable hair extensions.

loans.name: Anhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Anhtuya is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children, in a ger in Sainshand soum of Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her husband Batbayar, 42, works as a retail salesperson of pelts, at a local market. Her son Shinetsogt, 19, studies at university, her daughter Bayartsetseg, 15, is a secondary school student, and her youngest daughter Bolortsetseg, 4, goes to the local kindergarten. 

Anhtuya has been working as a tailor at a private tailoring company for over 10 years, and she has obtained a lot of experience. Now, she is starting her own business, a tailoring service, in a local shopping center, which is the best place to operate a tailoring service. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase an automatic sewing machine, and inventory with which to start her new tailoring business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase an automatic sewing machine, and inventory with which to start her new business, a tailoring service, in a local shopping center.

loans.name: Baasanhuu

texts.en: Mrs. Baasanhuu is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a small house in Arkhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Osohbayar, age 50, is an interior designer and works part-time at a private construction company. Her son, Altanshagai, age 21, works with his father as an interior designer, and her daughter, Altanchimeg, age 16, studies at a specialized training school. She has been working at a local pharmacy since 2006. She has obtained a lot of experience within the industry, and now she is planning to start her own pharmacy business selling natural medicine within the local area. She is planning to expand her business in order to improve her living situation and is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory and to cover her first month's rental fee. She is a hardworking, helpful, and diligent women.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and cover her first month's rental fee

loans.name: Victor B's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers at a secondary school in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. These teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni (in northern Sierra Leone), to request a loan of 5,000,000 leones for both of them. With the help of this loan, these teachers can overcome their immediate financial challenges, and, at the end of each month, they can repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Tamba is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old is single with no children. A native of Tangobu village, Tamba has been in the teaching profession for many years now. Tamba is pursuing further studies in college; he is going to use his share of the loan to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en:
Mahasen is 22 years old, married and has no children yet. Her husband is a worker whose low income is not enough to cover all the household costs.
Mahasen and her husband live in a small village, their house is old and needs some repairs. She is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of installing new doors and painting their house. This loan will cover the necessary repairs to Mahasen's house so she and her husband could enjoy living in it
Mahasen is photographed outside her house.

loans.use: to repair the house.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is 33 years old, married and has two sons, both students. For the past 10 years, Amjad has run a cosmetics store selling different types of cosmetics and women's accessories. This business is distinguished by its location in a high-traffic area and it has many loyal customers. It is a profitable business and the only source of income for Amjad and his family, but also it needs financial support from time to time to meet expenses.
Amjad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of cosmetics and accessories to sell. This will attract more customers having more choices and buying, which will increase sales and improve Amjad's income.
Amjad is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Deena

texts.en:
Deena is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Riziq appears in this Kiva profile photo inside their new house.
Deena is 25 years old, married and mother to one son and one daughter. Her husband is a worker whose low salary is not enough to cover the family's needs.
Deena and her husband have been building their own new house and now they want to complete the project by painting the inside and installing electrical extensions, among other improvements.
Due to a money shortage, Deena is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover these costs. Taking out this loan will enable Deena and her family to move into their house soon and enjoy living in suitable conditions.

loans.use: to complete the house by installing electrical extensions and painting the interior.

loans.name: Dukundumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Madame Spéciose fait partie du groupe solidaire appelé DUKUNDUMURIMO. Elle fait l’agriculture des ognons. Elle est mariée, âgée de 35 ans et a 9 enfants dont le plus âgé a 28 ans et le moins âgé a 5 ans. Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école et n’a aucune autre personne en sa charge.
Elle est née au Rwanda et a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 8ème primaire.
En 2011 c’est quand elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd, et actuellement est au 3ème cycle de crédit. Les deux  premiers  cycles sont remboursés  sans aucun retard.
Pour le crédit demandé, elle  va acheter les semences et paiera la main d’œuvre avec la partie restant.
Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Comme stratégie, Madame Spéciose  va chercher le  marché pour sa production pour la vendre en grande quantité et elle va gagner plus. Cette stratégie permettra la croissance de son activité agricole.
Pour son agriculture, elle a l’ambition d’être la grande cultivatrice dans la région. 
Pour sa famille, elle va assurer le bien être de sa famille et paiera les frais scolaires/académiques de ses enfants jusqu’à l’université.
texts.en:
Spéciose belongs to the Dukundumurimo solidarity group and grows onions. She is married, 35 years old and has nine children, the eldest being 28 years old and the youngest five. Four of her children go to school and she does not have any other dependents. She was born in Rwanda and went to school until 8th grade of primary school.

She began her collaboration with ACB Ltd in 2011 and is now on her third loan cycle. The first two loans were repaid on time. With the loan she has now asked for she is going to buy seeds, and with the remainder she will pay labor costs. She does not expect any difficulties in repaying this loan. Speciosé's strategy is to seek out the market for her produce so that she can sell large quantities of it and earn more money. This strategy will allow her farming activity to grow. As far as her farming is concerned her ambition is to be the most significant farmer in the region. As for her family she will ensure its well-being and pay her children's education costs up until university level.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sameeh

texts.en:
Sameeh is 22 years old and single. He owns a small grocery store and also is a part-time construction worker.
Sameeh is preparing to get married soon. He has built his own house and needs to finish it. Due to a money shortage, he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting the house and installing new windows and doors.
Taking out this loan will help to speed-up the completion of Sameeh's house and enable him to prepare himself to marry soon and live in suitable conditions.
Sameeh is photographed in his house.

loans.use: to complete his house by installing new windows and doors and painting it.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 31-year-old single man. For the past 10 years, Ashraf has been selling fruits and vegetables to customers. He has a good reputation among his customers and is known for selling fresh fruits and vegetables. His business has been profitable and his only source of income, but sometimes he needs support to cover part of the costs.
Ashraf is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a large variety of seasonal vegetables and fruits to sell. This will enable Ashraf to meet his customers' demands and satisfy their needs, which will increase sales and improve Ashraf's income.
Ashraf is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Theeb

texts.en:
Theeb is a 30-year-old man. He is married and a father to one son and one daughter. Theeb is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past seven years, Theeb has been selling perfumes to customers. His store is located in a good traffic area. He has many loyal customers and has a good reputation in the market which makes his business a profitable one and a second source of income to the family. However, at times, the business needs more support to cover the costs.

Theeb is requesting a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the cost of purchasing a large collection of perfumes for resale. The new perfume collection will attract more and new customers which will increase sales and improve his income. Theeb is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie enjoyed her 15 years in the behavioral health field, but then the economy soured and she closed her office. She decided to pursue her dream of becoming a chocolatier. “One holiday season we bought some confections from a well-known candy giant; after sampling our purchase, my children said that I could do better.”

Valerie started Zuzu Candies in February of 2012 in a rented commercial kitchen in Modesto, California. Over the past year she has refined her recipes, using local farmer’s market ingredients. She established the business and hired her good friend’s college-aged daughter to help with sales. Her chocolate does well at the local farmer’s market; she won five stars for her French Honey Caramels in a very competitive competition that got her noticed by a well-known market in Los Angeles.

Valerie has being doing everything by hand - a long and tiring process. She needs professional machinery to be able to produce enough chocolate and maintain proper temperature for her new, expanded markets. She would like to buy tabletop chocolate tempering machines that will allow her to produce up to 20 pounds of chocolate at one time.

Valerie is a single mother with three children. Her son Derek attends community college in Los Angeles and works part-time in the business, delivering chocolates to the local markets. She is requesting this loan because banks in her area do not make loans to startup businesses, so she turned to Fresno CDFI for financing.

If you would like to visit Zuzu Candies visit: www.zuzucandies.com

loans.use: To purchase 2 chocolate mixing machines and packaging materials for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Akwele

texts.en:
Akwele is an artisan in Ghana who specializes in handcrafted jewelry made from recycled materials. She would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as paper, glue, hooks, and clasps; and she would also like to employ additional workers to assist her in production.

Akwele has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I believe in art and in practicing it in a clever way. I have followed my passion to express myself naturally. My work is a continuous process of experimentation, research, and development, and this has earned me a number of awards nationally and internationally for both my paintings and my jewelry collections. One can never finish discovering what nature has to offer, so from a place of the spirit and with joy, gratitude, and delight I am going deep and deeper with my works in order to share with the world."

"I thank you for your support via this microcredit, as it allows me to continue making my jewelry."

Use the link below to view Akwele's recycled paper jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1847

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as paper, glue, hooks, and clasps; and also to employ additional workers to assist her in production

loans.name: Gusti

texts.en:
Gusti is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted and painted wood dolls and decorative items. He would like to stock up on the wood he uses for his carvings, to increase production.

Gusti has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I was born to a family of farmers, and I worked after school to ensure my education. We were six children, so my parents could hardly invest in our education. I also took a part-time job finishing and adding color to art products. Since school, my artwork has always been admired. After I graduated from a technical school, a friend suggested painting on a piece of wood, and the result was very nice. I thoroughly enjoyed it and have been dedicated to this art form ever since."

"Thanks much to God and to all of you who are helping me with this micro-credit. With the money, we can buy wood and increase our production. With this, we hope sales will increase so my team can have a better income, and the daily needs of our families can be covered. It's good to help small artisans. Thank you for everything."

Use the link below to view Gusti's wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3696

loans.use: to stock up on the wood he uses for his carvings, to increase production

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Ahmad, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Hana is a 30-year-old, married woman. She is a mother to two sons. For the past 20 years, Hana's family has had a small sewing workshop and now Hana and her husband, Ahmad, are operating this workshop. The workshop has been profitable and is the only source of income to the family, but it needs more support to cover some necessary costs.

Hana wants to expand her workshop, so she is requesting a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the cost of purchasing an additional, new sewing machine.
