This will improve the quality of work and meet high customer demand in less time, which will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase an additional, new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 59-year-old woman. She is divorced and the mother of one daughter, who lives with her.

Mariam is a bank employee and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover her needs. She wants to improve her living conditions at home, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to complete the price of purchasing new living room furniture. This will enable Mariam and her daughter to enjoy living in their house. Mariam, herself, appears in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: 060104Quang Trung- Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Tương works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise. 
Tương is 30 years old and she is married with two children.
She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 060104 Quang Trung- Hoằng Châu solidarity group. 
Tương supports two dependents with her business in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Tương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Tương has been involved in this business for 9 years.
The main hardship that Tương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Tương hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 35 años de edad, soltera del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del  país. Sin hijos, Juan Carlos tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 11 anos. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se venden productos en pequeñas cantidades como caja de fosforo, cigarro menudeados, sobre de café, sobre se shapoo, aceite, azúcar, pan, leche, el negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo y por no poder terminar los estudios universitarios. Y en la actualidad ya ha podido administrar el negocio y a la fecha ha sido rentable. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos de consumo diario para el hogar. Juan Carlos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 35, is single and has no children.  He's from the department of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Juan Carlos's job is a "pulpería" located in his house for the past 11 years.  A "pulpería" is a small store that sells small quantities of products, such as a box of matches, individual cigarettes, an envelope of coffee or shampoo, oil, sugar, bread, and milk.  The business came about because he needed a job and wasn't able to finish his university studies.  Currently he has been able to manage the business and up to now it has been profitable.

He needs the loan to invest in working capital and stock his business with products for daily household consumption.

Juan Carlos is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a decent living.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store and invest in working capital

loans.name: Cecilia Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia Magdalena, esta casada, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio este trabajo con una de sus hermana y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos para el tejido de cortes típicos, espera tener  un negocio grande y con capital propio, para generar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Cecilia Magdalena is married and 39 years old.  She never had the opportunity to study, but she has three children who are currently in school.  She works as a weaver of traditional skirts.  She began this work with one of her sisters, and she now has 2 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who supports her economically.

She is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy thread to weave traditional skirts, and she hopes to have a large business with her own money invested to make her living.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is 42 years old, married, and has one child. She began her business 15 years ago, raising chickens and turkeys and selling the cockerels and eggs in the market near her home. Additionally, she sells vegetables and grain products that she grows at her plantation. Her difficulty is that the stall for chickens is not safe; they often get sick and die.  

With this loan of 1000 AZN, Fati will make necessary repairs to her home that are important to her. Her dream is to make her house out of cement and to grow her business with her efforts.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home.

loans.name: Nengah

texts.en:
Nengah is a Balinese artisan who specializes in hand-carved wood animal sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of wood so that he can increase production. 

Nengah has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"From an early age I loved natural things: plants, animals, birds, and sea life. When I was still quite young I knew I had an ability to translate nature into artful things of beauty. Although I have no formal art training and work purely from my own inspiration and intuition, I know what looks good and what doesn't look right in a carving. I particularly want to create wildlife and other animal themes in an exact, realistic, and original way."

"Thank you for your support through this microcredit. For me it means an opportunity to continue making my business grow, so many thanks to you all!"

Use the link below to view Nengah's hand-carved wood art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4660

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of wood so that he can increase production

loans.name: Yaqoub

texts.en:
Yaqoub is a 39-year-old, married man. He is a father to two sons and one daughter. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Yaqoub has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a good second source of income for the family. Yaqoub wants to own a taxi, to improve his earnings. Therefore he is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN, to help him cover the price of purchasing a new taxi. Owning the taxi will enable Yaqoub to work extra hours and to accept additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively. Yaqoub is photographed next to his taxi.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fee. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing the taxi

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, 31, is a married entrepreneur from Lapasan, Clarin. He has three children.

He is earning from his transport service business. He has been in business for almost six years now and he earns PHP 4,000 a month. 

To improve his business, he is borrowing an amount of PHP 6,500 from GDMPC Microcredit, which he just joined recently. He will use the loan to obtain accessories and tires. 

He is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Dewa Ayu and the members of the Sinar Rejeki group continue to have a loan from MUK. They want to increase the number of pigs they raise and, therefore, increase income for their families. Dewa Ayu now has a local sow. She will use the new loan to purchase superior piglets, which she will keep for five months. Her husband supports her business because it is increasing the income of their family. She hopes to grow this business to provide for the welfare of her family.

One of the members of the original group resigned because she moved to the city to work there. She has been replaced by a new member.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is 28 years old, single, and lives in Sebac, Tudela. She earns a living by selling rice. She has been doing this for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from this work. Dinah has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to buy more rice to sell. Dinah just recently joined GDMPC. Dinah hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Gordove

texts.en: Gordove lives in Sangay Daku, Ozamis City. For 25 years, he has earned a living and supported the needs of his two children by proving transportation services. He earns an income of 5,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 49-year-old father, there is nothing that can make him happier than seeing his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Gordove has borrowed 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair the vehicle used in his business and to provide his children a better education. He is new to GDMPC. His plan for the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transportation vehicle

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. Arlene owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products, which she has been doing for 27 years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

Arlene is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as milk, diapers, and food products. She joined GDMPC in 2011.  In the future, Arlene wants to build a house and complete the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase items such as milk, diapers, and food products.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Canibungan Daku, Clarin. To make a living, Wilma grows coconuts to sell, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns 4,000 PHP a month. Wilma is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Wilma joined GDMPC in 2010. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega -31 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ALFA Y OMEGA -31 está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Alicia  tiene 49 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 14, 16  y 18 años, todos  se encuentran estudiando en la universidad,   La Sra. Alicia se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Alicia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Alicia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Alicia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Alfa y Omega-31 Communal Bank is made up of four members, six women and two men.  The president of the bank is Alicia, 49.  She has three children, aged 14, 16, and 18, all of whom are studying in the university.  Alicia makes a living selling a variety of staple items in her neighborhood store such as groceries, sweets, soda, and other things.

This loan is her second sequence with the institution.  Alicia's going to use this loan to buy a variety of groceries to stock her business: rice, pasta, flour, and sugar wholesale.  This way she'll offer her customers a variety of products.

Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving in her business.  Alicia's going to use the profits to continue buying products and improving her income.  Her desire for her business is to have a big store and give her customers better service.

Alicia's a very hardworking person.  She's happy for this opportunity being given to her and her bank colleagues because in many cases they're people who get their families ahead by themselves.

loans.use: to buy groceries and soda

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria de 49 años, reside en la comunidad de San Agustín. Tiene 3 hijos y son su mmayor motivación en la vida. Ella se dedica en la producción de cacao orgánico, activiada que la hecho reconocida en su localidad. Se desempeña de manera independiente, desde hace 27 años, teniendo el firme apoyo de sus hijos en diversas actividades. Asimismo contrata jornaleros para trabajos de mayor fuerza.Se siente muy reconfortada por su labor ya que le agrada levantarse desde muy temprano, preparar sus alimentos y dirigirse a sus parcelas para iniciar las labores diarias, pues según comenta, es una rutina del que nunca se aburrió, no obstante solo las temporadas de lluvia excesiva le impiden desplazarse por sus parcelas de manera fluida ya que son terrenos algo inclinados complicando sus labores.
Su fruto final es el cacao que deben estar bien secas y limpia de impurezas para posteriormente expenderlos a los acopiadores de la zona y ser transportados incluso al exterior.
Para iniciar la siguiente campaña, necesita contar con capital para contratar jornaleros y proceder con el primer deshierbo de maleza, esencial para una producción de calidad, asimismo comprar sacos de abono orgánico que refuercen la capacidad productiva de sus parcelas.
Sus metas a futuro apuntan a iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. 
 Por ello con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá contratar jornaleros y comprar sacos con abono orgánico y guano de ave para reforzar su producción.
texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old and resides in the community of San Agustín. She has three children and they are her main motivator in life.  She is involved in the production of organic cacao (chocolate), an activity which has made her well-known in her community.  She has gotten herself out of debt independently, and for the past 27 years, she has had the staunch support of her children in many of her activities.  She also hires day laborers for work that requires more strength.  She feels very encouraged by her work, since it suits her to get up early, make food, and go right out to her fields to begin her daily work.  As she has mentioned, it is a routine that never bores her, in spite of the fact that the rainy seasons that are especially wet keep her from going out to her work easily, since her lands are steeply sloped, complicating her labors.

Her final product is the cacao bean, which needs to be well dried and cleaned of impurities to later vend to merchants in her area and be transported internationally.

To begin her next campaign, she needs to have working capital to hire day laborers and proceed with the first weed removal of the season, essential for a good quality product, and also for her to buy sacks of organic fertilizer that will strengthen the production capacity of her fields.

Her goals for the future include starting to build herself a house made of quality materials.

With these 1,000 Soles, she will be able to hire day laborers and buy sacks of fertilizer and bird feces to strengthen her production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Juana Margarita esta casada, tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad  de estudiar, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus padres, y hasta a el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un préstamo, le servirá para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores, para incrementar su producción de tejidos de cortes, espera en el futuro tener un capital propio, y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Margarita is married and 40 years old.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She is a weaver.  She began this business thanks to the support of her parents, and she now has over ten years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who is a construction worker.

She is asking for a loan which will serve to buy threads of different colors to increase her production of woven skirts.  She hopes in the future to have her own money and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: El Sr. Emilio tiene 35 años, casado con 3 hijos, el Sr. Emilio se dedica a la venta de salchipapas en su pensión que se encuentran ubicado  en la zona Vita de la ciudad de La Paz, es un lugar muy concurrido ya que sus salchipapas son deliciosas por eso tiene mucha clientela, también ofrece refrescos naturales,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Emilio va a usar este préstamo para compra de una plancha para freír sus salchichas e insumos como papa y aceite,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar la actividad, Emilio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el de no tener patente. El va a utilizar los beneficios en eso en tramitar una patente con la alcaldía para así poder vender tranquilo.
texts.en: Emilio is 35 years old, married, with three children.  He sells salchipapas from his stand in the Vita zone of La Paz.  He does a lot of business because his salchipapas are delicious, so he has lots of customers.  He also sells natural soft drinks.  This will be his first loan through the institution and Emilio will use the money to buy a griddle to fry his food.  He will also buy ingredients like potatoes and cooking oil.  He wants to improve his business.  Emilio has challenges in his business, such as not having a permit.  He will also use the benefits to pay for a permit from the city hall, so he can sell calmly.

loans.use: to buy a grill, ingredents, and a permit.

loans.name: 060302Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry and cattle to raise, which she will resell in the future. 

The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She conducts her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Minh is 29 years old, married, and has two children, who are dependent on her. 

She is the leader of a three-member borrowing group, the 060302Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu  solidarity group. Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2005, to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid six previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Minh hopes to make enough money in the future to provide for her children, for them to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is from Talibon, Bohol and is married with a one-year-old son.

He has been engaged in fishing for four years now. This is the source of his income. His monthly earnings are 15,000 PHP. His wife is a housekeeper.

Christopher is requesting a loan to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. Through this loan, he will be able to catch more fish.

Christopher dreams of expanding his business in the future. He plans to build his own house and to educate his child in the future.

loans.use: to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en: Eloisa is a 43-year-old married entrepreneur with four children from Sebac, Tudela. She has operated a transport service business for almost four years now and earns 5,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing 6,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which she just joined recently to buy accessories and tires. Before long, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en:
Because the price of feed is high, the Tegal Sari group has received another loan of the same amount. At the time of disbursement of funds, one member was not present due to attending ceremony at the temple. Each member received 1,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy superior quality piglets and feed.

Ni Ketut used the loan to buy two superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives her pigs the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. If she has enough savings, she will use that money to raise pigs.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets and quality feed

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four grown children and two children under the age of 18. She has been engaged in a piggery business for 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Lourdes is requesting a loan to buy feed and more piglets. Through this loan, she will be able to raise and sell more pigs and can generate more income. In the future, Lourdes hopes to expand her business. She wants her two youngest children to continue their schooling to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy feed and more piglets

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 50-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children and three children under the age of 18. For 28 years, she has been engaged in a shell-buying business. In addition, she also has a sari sari store (variety store) as her second business. Overall, her monthly earning is 18,000 PHP. This is the source of her income.
 
Grace is requesting a loan to buy more shells and additional stock items for her sari sari store. Through this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for her business. In the future, Grace dreams of expanding her business so that her children can continue their schooling.

loans.use: to buy more shells and items for her sari sari store.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Jesucristo es mi modelo” que conforman 11 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio, pasan a su 04 ciclo. Graciela tiene 37 años, casada y 04 hijos menores. Desde hace 03 años Graciela se dedica a la venta de comida variada en su casa a su vez vende caldo de gallina en las noches y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Graciela  ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, arroz, insumos. Su sueño es un día tener un local más grande, para así atender mejor a sus clientes. Graciela está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva. Graciela se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás, la primera del lado derecho, viste polo negro y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the group “Jesucristo es mi modelo” (Jesus is my example) which is made up of 11 members who are involved in different commercial activities.  They are in their 4th cycle.  Graciela is 37 years old, married, and has 4 small children.  For the past three years, Graciela has been working selling a variety of foods out of her house, and she also sells chicken soup each night, and counts on a regular clientele.

Graciela has asked for this loan to buy sodas, rice, and fresh products.  Her dream is to have a larger location some day to better serve her customers.  Graciela is very pleased about this loan and thanks Edaprospo and Kiva. 

In the photo, Graciela is located in the back row, first on the right, wearing a black shirt and black pants.

loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, and groceries.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie, 52, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Melchor, a laborer, and the mother of her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household, while operating a business. She is working hard continually, to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Julie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages, to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julie hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages that she will sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 63 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by selling rice seed in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional seed to sell.

Anita has been selling rice seed for 11 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seed for her business

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida de 50 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad. Del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Elida tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva variada. Desde hace 10 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio consiste en la venta de ropa como pantalón, camisas, faldas, short, vestidos, camisolas, ropa interior, ropa de cama. La rutina diaria de Elida es trabajar una 10 horas diarias con un bulto de 20 kg  para ofrecer su mercadería de forma ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales. El negocio surgió hace muchos años por la necesidad de tener un ingresos para su familia  ya que en ese momento estaban pasando una situación difícil porque su esposo  no tenía trabajo. En la actualidad el negocio le ha brindado ganancias y hasta la fecha ha sido su medio de trabajo y su fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento  lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar mercadería nueva. Su sueño es llegar acondicionar su casa  y poner su tienda de ropa para dejar de vender de forma ambulante.  Elida agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para  tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Elida is 50 years old, married and has three adult children.  She is from Chinandega Department, which is located in the western part of the country.  Elida has worked for 10 years selling various articles of new clothing, such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, camisoles, underwear and bedclothes.  Her daily routine is to work 10 hours per day with a bundle weighing 20 kg offering her merchandise as a travelling vendor to both regular and occasional customers.  She started her business many years ago out of necessity in order to provide income for her family, since at that time they were going through a difficult situation because her husband did not have work.  Currently, her business generates profits and is her daily work and source of income.

Elida needs financing in order to invest in working capital and to buy new merchandise.  Her dream is to someday renovate her home and install her clothing store in it, instead of selling her merchandise as a travelling vendor.  Elida is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified way to work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business by buying and selling merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, camisoles, underwear and bedclothes.

loans.name: Dionisio Eduardo

texts.es: Dionisio de 62 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 22 años, e independiente económicamente. Él es originario del departamento de Chinandega, municipio el Viejo  lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Y se caracteriza por ser una zona costera productiva en la pesca, en la compra y venta de mariscos. Tiene 13 años de tener el negocio. El marisco lo vende en su casa, y las pesca la realiza en unos de los estero de la localidad. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de un medio de subsistencia  y con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar sus equipos de pesca. Hoy en día ha sido su forma de vida y de su familia. Dionisio ha recibido préstamos de fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de  pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en el negocio y comprar equipo de pesca como redes, canas, anzuelos, motor. Dionisio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Dionisio, 62, is married and has a 22-year-old son who is economically independent. He is originally from the municipality of “El Viejo”, Chinandega region, in the western part of the country. This region is known to be good for fishing and seafood trade.

Dionisio has had this business for thirteen years now. He sells seafood at home and fishes in one of the village’s estuaries. He started this business as a way to survive and with hard work he managed to buy the fishing equipment he now has. This is what he currently does for a living.

Dionisio has received loans from the foundation and has proved to be responsible and pay on time and the right amount. He needs the loan to invest in his business; he will buy fishing equipment such as nets, rods, hooks and an engine.

Dionisio appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give to people with few resources from poor countries like Nicaragua, which allows them to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in fishing equipment such as nets, rods, hooks and an engine.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa 44 años de edad, originaria de la Ciudad de Chontales, pero tiene 22 años de vivir  en Managua, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella inicio trabajando en una empresa textilera, pero luego decidió renunciar y con la liquidación que le dieron , decidió poner su propio negocio,  fue a comprar mercadería en general como ropa, zapato, blusas, faldas etc para vender ambulante. Ella considera que es un negocio  muy rentable, también dice que le ha ido muy  bien, además de este negocio tiene otro como es la costura y el  alquiler de dos  cuartos,  ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo.
Teresa solicita el préstamo para comprar  ropa, zapato, vestidos, faldas, etc. Al comprar esta mercadería de alta demanda podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus  clientes, cumpliéndoles con su encargo en tiempo y forma y asi obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio, sus planes futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.Sus metas próximas es ampliar su negocio y poder pagar el préstamo, para luego solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 44, is from the city of Chontales, but she has lived in Managua for 22 years. She has three grown children and is a merchant who sells clothing. She started off working for a textile company, but later decided to quit. With her severance pay, she decided to open her own business and went out to buy general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, blouses, dresses, etc. to sell door-to-door. She feels that this is a very profitable business. She also says that it has gone very well for her. On top of this business she has another-sewing. She also rents out two rooms. Her son helps her.
Teresa is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing, shoes, dresses, skirts, etc. Buying these high-demand products will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs, providing them with their orders properly and on time. This will allow her to make more income in her business. Her plan for the future is to improve her house. Her next goals are to expand her business and pay off the loan; then she will request another.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, dresses, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú!!! Este es el nuevo  grupo “Esfuerzo De Mujeres” conformado por 06 personas responsables y trabajadoras. Esther una de las socias, tiene 23 años casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas a reparto, este negocio surgió con la idea de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo a podido comprarse 02 motos la cual brinda como servicio de transporte, generando un ingreso extra para su hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos como arroz, fideos, menestras y una vitrina donde pueda guardar sus productos. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Esfuerzo De Mujeres” agradecen el crédito brindado. Esther es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo  color plomo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú!!! This is the new “Esfuerzo De Mujeres” group, made up of six responsible and hard-working women. Esther, one of the members, is 23 and married with three dependent children. She currently sells and delivers food. She created this business with the goal of offering her family a better quality of life. With her work and the help of her husband, she has been able to buy two motorcycles for providing a transportation service, generating an extra income for her household. She will use this loan for the purchase of supplies like rice, noodles, mixed vegetables, and a display case in which to keep her products. Her greatest desire is to keep improving her business. The Esfuerzo de Mujeres group is grateful for this loan. 
Esther is pictured third from the right in grey.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, noodles, mixed vegetables, and a display case.

loans.name: Nelis Nohemy

texts.es:
La  Señora Nelis  tiene 28  años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de hamacas de hilo, hamacas de lona, hamacas de seda, hamacas de cáñamo y lazos, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan, ellos  le prefieren por su amabilidad y su buen trato.
Doña Nelis está solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para compra de hilos, lona, hilo de algodón, nilón, seda, agujas y tijeras que es la materia prima para la elaboración de sus hamacas de diferentes formas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y  de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña Nelis sueño es terminar de hacer el muro de su casa de habitación.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Nelis is 28 years old and lives with her husband in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  For the past 15 years she has been selling rope, canvas, and hemp hammocks, and loops.  Her friends and neighbors are her customers.  They visit her and prefer her because of her friendliness and good service.

She is asking for loan for 5,000 Lempiras to buy rope, canvas, cotton twine, nylon, hemp, needles, and scissors to be able to make hammocks of different types.  This loan will help her to supply her business and increase her income.

Her hopes are to be able to complete her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Silvia Magdalena

texts.es: la Sra. Silvia sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior credito, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion d ecomidas con papa, carne y variedad de vegetales, se siente feliz ya que incremento su clientela y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en: Silvia continues to sell food and tells us that things went well with the previous loan.  This time she is asking for a loan in order to buy ingredients such as potatoes, meats, and vegetables.  She is happy about her increase in customers and her increased income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
This is Edita, She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children. She also has a house for rent for additional income. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and inventory, like clothing, footwear, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 40-year-old married woman with two daughters ages thirteen and ten years old. She has had a small sari sari or variety store and has also engaged in food vending as her second business for three years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Arlene is requesting a loan to buy brown sugar, 100 pcs. of coconut fruit and one sack of glutinous rice. The ingredients mentioned will be used to make biko, or sweetened sticky rice. It is the all-time Filipino favorite merienda or snack.

In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business because she wants to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy brown sugar, 100 pcs. of coconut fruit and one sack of glutinous rice

loans.name: 3.5.217.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chính works in the Thieu Hoa district, raising poultry and cattle, and has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby fowl to raise and sell in the future.  Chính is 52 years old and married with 4 grown children.  She is the leader of the 3.5.217.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  This is Chính’s first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  

One of her most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.  With her business profits, Chính hopes to support her children (find a good job, buy land of their own) and to buy more supplies/equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise/sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 25 boxes of cookies, 10 boxes of candy, and 15 liqueurs.

loans.name: 33-Villa Olmos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 33-VILLA OLMOS está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones, el  presidente del  banco es El Sr. Marcelino  tiene 52 años y es casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 23, 18 y 17 todos ya en la universidad  él se dedica al oficio de carpintero, realiza todo tipo de trabajos en madera desde cucharas, cucharones servilleteros hasta muebles,   esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien  era carpintero el Sr. Marcelino utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de  madera por mayor y materiales para la fabricación de muebles, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo,  ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido con el institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “33-Villa Olmos” communal bank has 8 members, five women and three men.  The bank president is Marcelino, 52, who’s married and has three children whose ages are 23, 18 and 17; they are all attending university.  He’s a carpenter and does all sorts of jobs with wood from spoons and ladles to napkin holders even furniture.  He learned this activity from his father who was also a carpenter.

Marcelino will use this loan to buy wood at wholesale and other furniture-making supplies.  His reason for requesting this loan is the lack of capital to buy this work material.  This is the only activity he has that makes it possible for him to support himself and support his family which is why he feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy wood and other furniture-making supplies.

loans.name: Berthalina

texts.es: Berthalina de 51 años de edad, casada  con seis hijos, de los cuales 2 son menores de edad, y están estudiando. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Su actividad económica es un pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, la cual consisten en vender productos de consumo diario para el hogar y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobre de café, sobres de shampoo, aceite, pan, leche, huevos, caja de  fosforo, verduras, refresco. Esta señora ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Actividad que surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo y una fuente de ingresos. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y satisfacer a sus clientes. Berthalina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Berthalina is fifty-one years old, married and has six children, two of them are underage and attend school. She is originally from the Chinandega region, in the western part of the country. She has a small shop in her house, where she sells small quantities of basic consumer products such as coffee, shampoo sachets, oil, bread, milk, eggs, matches, vegetables and beverages.

Berthalina has worked before with the foundation and has proved to be responsible by paying on time and the right amount.

She started this line of work because she needed to have a job and a source of income. With the loan, she will invest in working capital and she will stock her business up in order to improve her income and serve her clients better. Berthalina appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give to people with few resources from poor countries like Nicaragua, which helps them to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for her small shop and to buy basic supplies such as coffee, oil, bread and milk.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old, married, and has children.  She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Milagros maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogs, and these are the profits that dealers are investing. Milagros' regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Milagros is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional supplies and merchandise products such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milagros hopes that her child who is studying nursing will finish her studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members * to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics..

loans.name: 3.5.219.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiến works in the Thieu Hoa district, raising poultry and cattle, and has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.  Chiến is 43 years old and married with 2 children.  She is the leader of the 3.5.219.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  This is Chiến first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  

One of her most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.  With her business profits, Chiến hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise/sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de 52 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos mayores de edad. Del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente. Chinandega se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial productiva. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería que consisten en vender productos como pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, perfumes, vestidos, short, camisolas. Desde hace siete años que desempeña dicha actividad. La rutina diaria de  María Isabel es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias con un bulto de unos 20 kg. Con mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería. María Isabel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: María Isabel, 52, is married and has three adult children.  She’s from Chinandega Department, a place located in the western zone.  Chinandega is noted for being a very commercially productive zone.  Her economic activity is selling merchandise consisting in pants, shirts, cosmetics, perfume, dresses, shorts and camisoles.  She’s been in said activity for seven years.  Her daily routine is to work about 10 hours with a 20-kilogram bundle of merchandise she sells to regular and drop-by customers.  She needs the financing to invest in working capital and stock up on merchandise.  María Isabel is grateful for the support Kiva lenders give to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS PERLAS está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Deisy  tiene 40 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 15, 12 y 8 años y todos se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años,  tiene su tienda en la localidad de la Guardia, con el dinero del crédito comprara abarrotes por cantidad como azúcar, arroz y aceite por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio,  ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecida a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The “Las Perlas” (Pearls) communal bank has 8 members, seven women and one man.  The bank president is Deisy, 40.  She’s married and has three children aged 15, 12 and 8; all attend school.  She sells groceries, an activity she’s been in for many years.  Her store is in La Guardia and she will use the loan to buy groceries like sugar, rice and oil in quantity and at wholesale.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she lacks capital to buy merchandise to stock her store and this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support herself and support her family which is why she feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy grocery items at wholesale.

loans.name: Leonidas Lucas

texts.es: Leónidas de 50 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos menores bajo su responsabilidad. Él es originario del Realejo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Leónidas tiene por actividad económica el servicio de juego se billares y elaboración de pangas para la pesca artesanal, el negocio está  ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 4  años que está desempeñando dicha actividad. La cual consiste en prestar servicios para juegos de billares como torneos entre jugadores. Y elaborar pangas de pesca, Leónidas ya ha tenido crédito con fundación  león 2000 y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma.  El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y darles mantenimiento a la mesas de billares y compra material para elaborar las  pangas. Materiales como madera, alquitrán, clavos, pega, pintura anticorrosiva. Leónidas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Leónidas is 50 years old, single, and has two young children who he is responsible for. He is originally from Realejo, in the west of the country.

Leónidas makes a living renting out pool tables and building canoes for artesanal fishing. His business is located in his home. He has been doing this job for the past four years. It involves providing pool table games for tournaments between players, and building fishing canoes.

Leónidas has already taken out a loan with Fundación León 2000, and has shown he is reponsible by paying properly and on time. He needs finance to invest in working capital, maintain the pool tables and buy materials to build the canoes. These materials include wood, tar, nails, glue, and anticorrosive paint. 

Leónidas is grateful for the help given by Kiva investors to people of limited means and poor countries such as Nicaragua to allow them work in a dignified manner.

loans.use: to invest in capital and buy materials such as wood, tar, nails, glue, and anticorrosive paint to build canoes, and to maintain pool tables.

loans.name: Alejandro Nicolas

texts.es:
el señor Alejandro Nicolas esta casado, tiene 45 años de edad, esta graduado como maestro de educacion primaria, tiene 7 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a impartir clases en una escuela estatal y también cuenta con un taller para tejido, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de su esposa, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en la elaboración de tejidos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores, espera producir mas y mejorar sus ingresos, espera en el futuro tener varios trabajadores, y varios telares para su taller.
texts.en: Alejandro Nicolas, 45, is married.  He graduated as an elementary school teacher.  He has seven children attending school.  He works teaching in a public school and also has a knitting workshop.  He started this business with support from his wife and to date has five years’ experience.  His wife helps him do the knitting.  He’s requesting a loan to buy yarn in various colors; he expects to produce more and increase his income. He hopes in future to hire several workers and to have several looms in his shop.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Brumilda Adriana

texts.es: Brumilda Adriana de 46 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad. Chinandega es un lugar que se caracteriza por ser una comercial productiva. Brumilda es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable. Tiene por actividad económica acopio de marisco desde hace 21 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio consiste en la compra y venta de mariscos. Y lo desempeña de forma ambulante y el mercado de la localidad.  Brumilda ya ha trabajado con fundación León 2000 y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. Brunilda  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Brumilda Adriana, 46, is from Chinandega.  She’s married and has three adult children.  Chinandega is a place noted for being very commercially productive.  Brumilda is a very hardworking, responsible person.  Her economic activity for the last 21 years has been selling seafood.  The business consists in buying and selling seafood and she does it both from place to place and in a local market.  Brumilda has worked with Fundación León 2000 previously and has been responsible with her payments making them on time as scheduled.  She needs financing to invest in working capital to stock her business.  Brumilda is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel es casado, tiene 26 años de edad, cursó 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la construcción de vivienda, como también a la sastrería, inició su negocio con solo una máquina y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a tiempo completo a la confección de tejidos.

solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para la compra de telas e hilos de diferentes colores, ya que espera en el futuro con tener mas trabajares.
texts.en: Miguel, 26, is married.  He completed six years of elementary school. He works in home construction but also as a tailor. He started his business with just one sewing machine and to date has 5 years’ experience. He has his wife’s support who is a full-time textile weaver. He’s asking for the loan to buy fabric and thread in different colors because he’s expecting more jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: 3.5.216.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise, which she will sell in the future.

Hòa is 32 years old, married, and has two children, who are her dependents. She lives and conducts her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hòa has been involved in her agricultural business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hòa is the group leader of the 3.5.216.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which is comprised of five members. This is the first loan for Hòa with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for them to do well in school, and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria 59 años de edad, originariade Masaya,pero vive en Managua, madre soltera tiene 1 hijo de 23 años, el cual esta estudiando en la universidad la carrera de mercadeo. Ella se dedica a la costura de ropa.Inicio  trabajando  en una empresa, pero luego al  quedar sin trabajos, se puso a estudiar costura para poder desempeñarse en el negocio de la costura, fue allí que decidió poner su propio negocio,  del que es propietaria hace mas de 20 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija que le ayuda con el negocio.
Ella esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, zíper, etc. Toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus trajes que le encargan sus clientes, ya que ella considera  que este préstamo  le ayudaría mucho a incrementar las ventas y asi obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es comprar un local que brinde mejores condiciones para poner su taller de costura y dar clases.
texts.en:
Maria is 59, she is originally from Masaya, but lives in Managua, she is a single mother of a 23-year-old son, who is in university studying marketing.  She works as a seamstress.  She began working for a company, but later on where she was left with no job, she started to study tailoring to work in the business as a tailor, that's when she decided to start her own business; she's had this business for more than 20 years, her son helps her in the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, zippers;  all the materials needed to tailor the items her clients request, she considers the loan would help her a lot to increase sales and obtain more profit, her future plans are to buy a commercial space that will provide better conditions to have her tailoring shop and teach.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Karen Esther

texts.es: Karen Esther de 28 años de edad, madre viuda  con dos hijos. Originaria del departamento de Chichigalpa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Karen tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como: pantalones, faldas, short, camisetas, ropa interior, cosméticos, adornos de pared. Actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante desde hace  6 anos. La rutina diaria de  Karen es trabajar todos los días 10 horas diarias con un bulto de unos 25 kg, donde lleva su mercadería a ofrecer a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. Bajo el intenso sol del día a día, pero agradece tener este medio de vida para brindarle a sus hijos menores condiciones económica, y más en este momento que enfrentan como familia el fallecimiento de su esposo y padre respectivamente. Karen ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería y aprovechar la temporada navideña y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes  e incrementar sus ingresos. Karen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Karen Esther is 28 years old, and is a widowed mother with two children. She is originally from the department of Chichigalpa, located in the west of the country.

Karen makes a living selling general merchandise such as as trousers, skirts, shorts, tops, underwear, make-up and wall hangings. She has worked as a mobile seller of these items for the past 6 years. Karen's daily routine involves working ten hours every day with a 25kg load, taking her merchandise to her regular customer as well as potential ones. 

She does this day by day in the intense heat, but she is grateful for this livelihood, which allows her to provide her young children with better financial circumstances. This is even more important at the moment, as they face the death of her husband and their father together. 

Karen has already worked with the Fundación and has demonstrated her responsibility by paying correctly and on time. She needs the money to invest in working capital, stock her business with merchandise, make the most of the Christmas season, and offer a better service to her customers, increasing her income. 

Karen is grateful for the help given by Kiva investors to people with limited means living in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with merchandise such as trousers, skirts, shorts, tops, underwear, make-up and wall hangings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yarn and dyes.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina de 45 años, natural de Santa Rosa, comparte una fabulosa vida conyugal con Germán de 39 años. Ambos tiene a su pequeña hija Flor de 10 añitos a quien dirigen todos su esfuerzos y sacrificio. Poseen una vivienda a base de adobe adquirida hace poco. Desde joven y con el antecedente de pertenecer a una familia netamente orientada a la producción agrícola, decidió sacarle el máximo provecho posible a unas parcelas que su padre le obsequio. Tras 20 años de trabajo, junto a su pareja tuvo que afrontar el difícil momento, pues su esposo en un accidente perdió la vista. Ahora ella debe contratar jornaleros para que la apoyen en el trabajo del campo, pues se dedica a la producción de cacao. Este grano, es un producto muy rentable y de temporada, cuya ganancia depende de la calidad que posee, y esto es posible gracias a las técnicas necesarias consistentes en sacar la maleza, fertilizar y evitar que los insectos se apoederen de la planta.
Ahora se encuentra en una nueva camapaña de siemrba de cacao, para ello necesita de capital para contratar jornaleros y puedan sacar la maleza, pues se debe tener cuidado, si entre su siembra hay plantas de almacigo, asimismo debe comprar guano de ave para afianzar la producción. 
Por tanto solicita 1,000 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en contratar jornaleros y comprar abono orgánico, como guano de aves.
texts.en:
Justina, 45, is from Santa Rosa.  She shares a fabulous married life with Germán, 39.  They have a little ten-year-old girl, Flor, who they focus all their efforts and sacrifice on.  They acquired their adobe house not long ago.  Since her youth and with the antecedent of being from a family totally dedicated to agriculture, she decided to get the most out of some parcels of land her father gave her.  After twenty years of work she and her spouse had to face a difficult moment because her husband had an accident that left him blind.  Now she must hire laborers to help with the work in the fields because she works growing cocoa beans.  This grain is seasonal and very profitable; its profits depend on its quality and this depends on the necessary techniques consisting in weeding, fertilizing and avoiding insect infestations that can invade the plant.

She’s now starting a new cocoa bean planting season and needs capital to hire workers to weed because it has to be done carefully in case there are any seedlings among the weeds; she also must buy fowl guano to secure production.  Therefore, she’s requesting 1,000 new soles to hire workers and to buy organic manure like fowl guano.

loans.use: to hire laborers and to buy organic manure like fowl guano.

loans.name: 3.14.207.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuyên has a business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Xuyên is 30 years old, and she is married and has two children..
Xuyên is the group leader of the 3.14.207.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which is comprised of four members. 
Xuyên supports two dependents with her business, in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is the first loan for Xuyên with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Xuyên has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuyên hopes to help her family to be healthy and happy, to help her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother of three young children, ages six, three, and seven months old, from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business for five years. This is the source of her income, with which she raises her children and provides for their daily needs.
 
Gloria is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, farm labor, and medicine. She will use part of the loan to make her crops healthy and nutritious. The other part of the loan will be used for medication for her children.

Gloria dreams of expanding her business in the future, because she wants to send her children to school. Being a single mother is not a hindrance for her to succeed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm labor for her crops, and medicine for her children.

loans.name: La Guama Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Neptaly, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo, vive con su esposa, hijo y su madre en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa barbara.
Neptaly, trabajo por varios años en el comercio, y hace 5 años se dedico a realizar cultivos de café, y hortalizas como pepinos y chile dulce.  Esta producción la vende en  el mercado local de la comunidad y a sus alrededores para obtener sus ingresos. El piensa ampliar sus cultivos en toda el  área de terreno que tiene y seguir dándole una buena asistencia técnica para mejorar la producción. Esta solicitando el primer ciclo de préstamo en forma grupal para fertilizar y limpiar sus cultivos de café, pepino y chile dulce, el  Grupo solidario tiene como nombre  La Guama, que está formado por 8 miembros, en la foto están identificados así: a la izquierda esta Neptaly, luego don Ruben, seguido por otro miembro llamado con el mismo nombre Ruben, Wilmer, Jose Antonio, Florinda, Dredvin  y a la derecha esta Jose Eusebio. Ellos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo total en grupo suma L. 40,500.00 y todos lo utilizaran para fertilizar y limpiar sus cultivos para mejorar la produccion y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Neptaly, 35, has a son; he lives with his wife, son and his mother in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  He worked for several years in commerce and five years ago started growing coffee and vegetables like cucumbers and sweet peppers.  He sells his production in the local market in his community and in surrounding areas to earn income.  He’s thinking of expanding his crops throughout the fields he owns and to continue giving them technical assistance to improve production.

He’s asking for his first loan cycle as part of a group loan to fertilize and weed his coffee, cucumber and sweet pepper crops.  The communal bank is called “La Guama” and it has 8 members.  In the photo they can be identified as follows: Neptaly is on the left, next is Ruben followed by another member who is also called Ruben, then Wilmer, José Antonio, Florinda, Dredvin and José Eusebio is on the far right.  They all live in the same community and work in agriculture.  The group loan is for 40,500 Lempiras and all of them will be using it for fertilizer and to weed their crops to improve crop yields and incomes.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 47 years old and married with three children.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family.  Josephine requested a loan of PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional stocks for her store (canned goods, egg, spices, etc.).  Josephine has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane, raising pigs, and managing motorcycle transport.  Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store (canned goods, egg, spices, etc.).

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda stopped her education in the 8th grade. She is a mother of two children; they live with her at home and are between the ages of 9 and 15 and are currently in school. She lives in the West Point community and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She learned this way of selling from her cousin, and she sells seven days a week, fourteen hours a day.

Linda sells bread with tea; she makes profit when she sells, because she renders good service to her customers, and her shop is in a good location. With the loan given her, she will purchase more tins of milk, bread, mayonnaise, packs of sugar, and Lipton tea to increase her sales. Her plan is to give her children a better education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more  tins  of milk, bread, mayonnaise, packs of sugar, and Lipton tea to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 34, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Lino. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennifer operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Jennifer also sells fish of different kinds and also meat. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jennifer dreams of having children and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: 03-01-62-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Len has a retail business selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Len is 58 years old, and she is married and has two grown-up children. She has no dependents.
Len is the group leader of the 03-01-62-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which is comprised of six members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Len joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Len has successfully repaid three previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Len has been involved in the vegetable selling business for three years.
The main hardship that Len faces in her business, is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Len hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well. Len also hopes for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Gloria Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es madre soltera y tienen bajo su responsabilidad tres hijo dos de sus hijos estudian la preparatoria y la mas pequeña la secundaria, con mucho esfuerzo a podido ayudar a sus hijos a tener un buen estudio, para que en su futuro sean unos triunfadores.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar los acabados del exterior e interior  de su casa ya que actualmente las paredes están deterioradas y necesitan algunas reparaciones pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora que es la compra de materia y pagarle a la persona quien se encargara de mejorar su casa y así este protegida su familia del clima ya que en temporada de lluvia hay humedad y no quiere que le afecte en la salud a sus hijos.
La señora Gloria trabaja  en limpieza de una casa particular y en las noches se dedica a cuidar un señor ya mayor de edad, con estos ingresos planea pagar el crédito.
La señora Gloria ya ha tenido créditos con KIVA los cuales han sido para pagar la educación de sus hijos, gracias a esta ayuda sus hijos han podido seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother of three children, two of them in preparatory school and the youngest in secondary school. She has put a lot of effort in helping her children to have good studies so that they will be successful in the future. 

She is requesting a loan to add the finishing to the exterior and interior of her house. The walls are currently deteriorated and need some repair, but right now she doesn't have enough money to make the improvement by buying the materials and paying the person that will be in charge. This improvement would protect her family from the weather, which is humid during the rainy season and could affect the health of her children. 

Gloria works cleaning a private house and at nights takes care of an elderly man. She plans to use the income she earns to repay the loan. Gloria has had loans with Kiva in the past that she used to pay the education of her children. Thanks to these loans her children have been able to continue studying.

loans.use: to add the finishing to the exterior and interior of her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser muy amable y social, está casada con Manuel quien se dedica al transporte, viviendo en compañía de sus 02 hijas de 19 y 08 años de edad, habitando la casa de su tío quien esta fuera del país hace 7 años. Las actividades que realiza María es la venta de zapatos femeninos, ropas de damas y caballeros y productos de belleza femeninos, todos estos productos los vende de manera personal, comprándolos  por catalogo y vendiéndolos entre sus familiares, sus vecinos y conocidos, a los que atiende de manera cordial y amable logrando ganarse sus preferencias y así la recomiendan con otras personas que se vuelven en clientes habituales, dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 05 años contando con el apoyo de sus esposo quien le ayuda en conseguir nuevos clientes y la transporta hacia los lugares donde tiene que entregar sus pedidos.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva, teniendo los deseos de convertirse en una prospera empresaria, considerando a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, con las cuales desea ampliar su stock de productos, tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de un mayor número de mercadería para tener un stock disponible para la venta, de esa manera espera conseguir precios más bajos por sus compras en volúmenes.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and is a very hardworking dedicated woman.  She is also friendly and social and married to Manuel, who provides transportation services.  They have two daughters, ages 19 and 8 and live in her uncle’s house, who has been out of the country for seven years.

Maria sells women’s shoes, and men’s and women’s clothing and beauty products.  She sells everything herself by buying them through a catalog and reselling them to her friends, family, and neighbors, to whom she provides cordial, friendly service.  They recommend her to others and they also become steady customers.  She’s been doing this for five years, with her husband’s support.  He helps her find new customers and makes deliveries.

She likes her business because it generates an income for her, allows her to work and feel productive, and she wants to have a successful business.  Her business is profitable and leaves her a great income, which she wants to use to expand her stock.  This will be her third loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support and she will feel good about moving forward.  She is also comfortable with her communal bank and considers the members to be united.

She will use the 1,200 PEN to buy a large number of products to have in stock.  In this way she can get better prices.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en:
Jubelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronic reloading (prepaid phone credits) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional load to sell for her electronic reloading business.

Jubelyn has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from a general store and farming sugarcane.

Jubelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic load (prepaid phone credits) to sell.

loans.name: 03-02-64-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mùi is applying for a loan to purchase liquor, beer, and snacks to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant, selling liquor, beer, and snacks.
