Mùi is 32 years old, married, and has two children.
Mùi is the group leader of the 03-02-64-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which is comprised of seven members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2010, Mùi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mùi has successfully repaid three previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Mùi has been involved in her business for six years.
The main harship that Mùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes to build a new house, to help her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase liquor, beer, and snacks to resell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Frank, a factory worker, and mother to her children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household, while she operates the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Corazon sells different frozen and processed products. These products are very salable, especially in families who have children going to school. It’s cheap and easy to prepare for children’s packed lunches. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy frozen and processed food products, like hot dogs, steamed buns, ham, stuffed meat, and other related products. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands the business. 

Corazon hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for frozen and processed food products, like hot dogs, steamed buns, ham, stuffed meat, and other products.

loans.name: 03-08-66-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Tân is the group leader of the 03-08-66-Quảng Hưng Group, which consists of seven members. Tân is 53 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She lives with one dependent; two others are grown up.

Tân operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice cakes. Tân has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork to make rice cakes for sale.

In 2010, Tân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Tân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork to make rice cakes for sale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a 36-year-old married woman with three daughters who are 14, 12 and eight years old. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol, where she has run a fishing business for the last 20 years. This is how she supports her family, and she is requesting a loan to buy fish nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. This loan will allow her to increase her income by catching more fish. Lolita's goal for the future is to expand her business because she wants to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: 04.7.6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thanh is the group leader of the 04.7.6 Nam Ngạn Group, which consists of three members. Thanh is 47 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She lives with no dependents, her children are grown up.

Thanh operates a food stall/restaurant selling bread. Thanh has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase bread for resale.

In 2010, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 31, lives in Bacoor, Cavite, the Philippines with her husband and children. She earns a living by running a general store where she sells various plastic items that she buys from wholesalers. Customers are attracted to her store because prices are low and there are many items to choose from. Most of her customers are neighbors and people who live in her community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy items such as toys, plastic ware and other related products. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business, and hopes to continue doing this so that she can give her children a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 people who meet  each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow her business and thus save for retirement.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin invirtió su anterior credikiva en mimbre y en una bicicleta para transportarse. Su principal beneficio fue la compra de   materiales al por mayor, que le generó más disponibilidad de productos y un mayor volumen de ventas. Su estrés ha disminuido pues han aumentado sus ventas y con ellos sus ingresos. Él dice a los financiadores de Kiva que, está muy contento, por la oportunidad que le dieron para poder crecer y dejar de prestar a costos altos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará madera, mimbre,  realizará mantenimiento preventivo a sus maquinarias y obtendrá buenos descuentos por su compra en volúmenes.
texts.en:
Agustin invested his previous credit Kiva loan in buying wicker, and a bicycle to get around with. His main benefit was the purchase of materials at wholesale, which resulted in more product availability and greater sales volume. His stress has lessened, as he has increased his sales, and with this, his income. 

He tells the Kiva lenders that he is very happy about the opportunity they have given him to be able to grow and stop borrowing at high cost. 

Currently he is applying for a credikiva loan, through which he will buy wood and wicker, do preventative maintenance on his machinery, and obtain good discounts on his bulk purchases.

loans.use: To buy wood and wicker, and do preventative maintenance on his machinery.

loans.name: 3.2.205.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương is 34 years old and married with three children. She supports three dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Phương works in agriculture, farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and livestock to raise. Phương has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2009, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương is the group leader of the 3.2.205.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In the future, Phương hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and livestock to raise.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Jocelyn would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She also makes leche flan and peanut butter for additional income. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes her business will continue to grow and dreams to become rich and successful in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz, 36, is a resident of Kitale who has been in active in farming on his home farm for ten consecutive years. He is married and has six children between three and fourteen years old. His farm produce currently includes milk and eggs, which he sells in the local market.

Boaz has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He says this will give him better farming income and generally help to improve the family farming business. His wish for the next five years is to run a farm with five quality dairy cows and to become a major supplier of both dairy and poultry products in the local market.

He mentions animal diseases as a common challenge in this business.

loans.use: to buy poultry for his dairy and poultry business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a farmer and the mother of four children, the youngest of whom is ten. She has been farming for ten years and currently runs the farm with the help of one farmhand. She sells her milk and eggs in the local market.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry. This is her second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo, and she stresses that it will help boost her farming business and provide better food for the family.

Beatrice mentions animal diseases as the main challenge in farming, especially for poultry and dairy businesses.

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer and the father of three children from 8 to 13 years old. He has nine consecutive years in active farming and currently produces eggs and milk for family consumption and for sale. He runs the farm with the help of one farmhand.

Robert has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry for his poultry business. He adds that his poultry business will help generate more income to educate his children. He plans to have a flock of two thousand birds, as well as three dairy cows.

He is optimistic he will be able to meet the educational needs of his children. He mentions animal diseases as the main challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry for his farm.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya, where he lives with his wife and their two children, ages 2 and 8. He has been farming for five successive years and runs the farm with the help of one farmhand. His farm currently produces eggs and maize to supply the local market.

Samuel has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He says this will help improve his family income and also improve his farming business, which he believes will grow to over one thousand birds and three quality dairy cows. He does, however, mention animal diseases as a challenge.

loans.use: to buy poultry for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: Nasreen is a 36-year-old woman who works hard while raising her one son and four daughters. Her husband is in military and her son works in a tire shop. One of her daughters is currently employed as a beautician. Nasreen is a tailor by profession and gets help in her business from one of her daughters. She works eight hours a day and uses her entire income to cover household expenses. Unfortunately, she has no money left to set aside for savings. Nasreen is a member of a four-person group which is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine for her daughter. Today she shares her sewing machine with her daughter, and they will be able to save time and work more efficiently with two machines. Nasreen hopes that this loan will be benefit both her and her daughter. In the photo, she is the person who holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en: Ms Ameera is 47 years old, married and earns a living by running a general store where she serves members of her community. Her store is located in a corner of her house and she has operated it for the last three years with the support of her husband, who we see here in the photo. She sells various items and goods for everyday use and has retained many regular customers. Mrs. Ameera is very motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan for PKR 20,000 to buy rice, flour and packets of oil in large quantities to meet growing demand from her customers. She will use part of the additional income she earns to pay for her children’s education and increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of Kitale, where she lives with her husband and two children, aged 17 and 2 years. She has been in farming for seven years and currently produces milk and eggs for the local market.

Catherine has made a loan request amounting to 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will channel the loan into purchasing and insuring one dairy cow. She is optimistic she will generate more income and acquire four more dairy cows within the next four years.

Catherine mentions the shortage of animal feed during dry seasons and animal diseases as the major challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es: Eunice de 41 años de edad, tiene un taller de ornamentación donde fabrica rejas, puertas y ventanas principalmente; su negocio está ubicado en un espacio de su domicilio,  en el municipio donde habita al lado de su cónyuge y sus  hijos en las edades de 3 a 10 años. Ella requiere comprar hierro, lijas, barras de soldadura, discos para pulir, con el fin de aumentar su producción y conseguir descuentos, por adquirir estas materias primas en volúmenes y lograr buenos precios, para trasladárselos a sus clientes al final de la operación. Su dinero es insuficiente para responder al crecimiento de su demanda, porque vende 50% a crédito y 50% de contado, y la capacidad de recuperación de la cartera no es oportuna para dar respuesta a sus pedidos, por lo cual invertir se convierte en un gran desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará los insumos necesarios para lograr ser efectiva y aumentar sus ingresos, una vez más, pues con el primer crédito logró dar cumplimiento a su fiel clientela, la cual ha construido desde hace 24 años cuando inició, después de haber tomado un curso en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA, y aprendió las operaciones básicas de la ornamentación: diseñar, medir, cortar el hierro, soldar, pulir, pintar e instalar. Hoy en su negocio tiene una frecuencia de ventas de 5 días, comprando los insumos de contado en distribuidoras de hierro. Con su negocio da cumplimiento al objetivo, por el cual nació su idea que es generar ingresos, para   apoyar los gastos del hogar, respondiendo así a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y al apoyo recibido de sus tíos  quienes le suministraron el primer capital de trabajo  para que algún día surgiera, como es el propósito con el que aun permanece soñando.
texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old and has an ornamental iron workshop where she makes grills; mainly for doors and windows. Her business is located in an area of her home, in the town where she lives with her partner and her children, ages 3 to 10. 

She needs to buy steel, sandpaper, welding rods and polishing disks. Her aim is to increase her output and obtain discounts by acquiring these raw materials in bulk and getting good prices. This is in order to pass them on to her customers at the end of the transaction. 

Her funds are insufficient to respond to the growth in her demand. This is because she sells 50% on credit and 50% for cash, and her recovery of debts is not timely enough to respond to her orders. For this reason, investing becomes a great challenge. This is why she is applying for a credikiva loan, her second with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

With the loan, she will buy the necessary supplies so that she can succeed in being effective and increasing her income once again. This because the first loan enabled her to fulfill the needs of her loyal clientele, which she has built in the 24 years since she began, after having taken a course through the National Learning Service (SENA). There she learned the basic elements of ornamental iron work: designing, measuring, cutting steel, welding, polishing, painting and installing. 

Today in her business, she has a sales frequency of five days, buying the supplies for cash at steel distributors. With her business she is fulfilling her objective, for which her idea was born, which is to generate income to help with household expenses, responding in this way to the lack of job opportunities and to the support she has received from her uncles. They were the ones who supplied her with her first working capital, so that someday she could get ahead in life, which remains the goal she still dreams of.

loans.use: To buy steel, sandpaper, welding rods and polishing disks.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Ms Abida is 53 years old, married and the mother of four children. For six years, she has earned a living by selling milk. She began her own business by buying a buffalo to make money to support her family and supplement her husband's income. With the passage of time, her sales have increased and also her income. Thanks to her courage and determination, she now has two buffaloes. She is respected in her home in part because of her work. She helps her husband in all family as well as financial matters. Her dream for the future is to provide her children with a quality education so that they can have good and rewarding lives. She is requesting her fifth loan from the Kashf Foundation. She has some savings and is requesting PKR 35,000 so that she has enough money to buy another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her herd. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is a 30-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three young children. 

She has had a farming business for six years now, together with her husband, who is at the same time a fisherman. Her monthly earnings are about 5,000 PHP. This is the source of her income. This is how they get their daily needs.

Mirabel is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and medicine. These three items are needed so their crops can grow healthy and to avoid pests that eat the crops.

Success in the farming business is Mirabel’s dream, so that in the future she will be able to send her children to school and assist their needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and medicine.

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Mujeres Positivas” que conforman 05 mujeres emprendedoras que pasan al ciclo 20. María tiene 47 años, casada con 04 hijos de la cual 01 de ellos en etapa escolar. María tiene su carrito sanguchero en la cual vende salchipapa, hamburguesa, pollito broster y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Con el crédito que solicito María comprará pollo, papas, aceite y platos descartables. Una de las metas de María es implementar una bodega bien surtida en su casa. María está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y Kiva. María se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás, es la primera del lado derecho viste polo azul.
texts.en: This is the Group " Positive Women" formed by 5 entreprenurial women that are in their 20th cycle.  Maria is 47, married with four children, one of them is in school.  Maria has a sandwich cart where she sells hot dogs and fries, burgers, chicken; she has loyal customers.  With the loan requested Maria will buy chicken, potatoes, oil and paper plates.  One of Maria's goals is to set up a well-stocked store from her home.  Maria is very happy about the loan and is thankful to Edapospo and Kiva.  Maria is the first one from the right, wearing blue.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potatoes, oil and paper plates.

loans.name: Mona Grace

texts.en:
Mona Grace is 31 years old and married, with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mona Grace is borrowing 18000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mona Grace has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from the buying and selling of rice and livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional inventory for her ready-to-wear clothing business.

Willy has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from selling generic medicines.

Willy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Mrs Kousar is a 52-year-old, married woman, who has been running a business of dairy farming, milking buffaloes, for the past ten years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo, in order to support her family and help her husband. With the passage of time her sales increased, and her income did also, and now she has two buffaloes.

She is the mother of five children; two of them are school-going. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared her dream to educate her other children as well. 

Kousar is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to help her to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to gain an increase in her net income, which she intends to spend on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for dairy use.

loans.name: Zubeeda

texts.en:
Ms Zubeeda is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of selling and purchasing goats for the past four years. She started her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Ms Zubeeda supports her family of seven members. With her husband's help, she runs a successful business to lead them to a decent life. 

Ms Zubeeda buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, raises them and sells them at higher prices. Her husband assists her by selling them in the market. Ms Zubeeda took a loan for the betterment of her business and to increase her livestock (goats). She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and thus better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been rearing goats for the past eight years and has been able to expand her business with the Kashf Foundation's help over the last five years. Ms Nasreen supports her family members. Her husband is very supportive of her business and he also earns a living with his donkey cart.

Ms Nasreen buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, raises them and sells them at higher prices. She took a loan for the betterment of her business and to increase her livestock (goats). She has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy two more baby goats. Ms Nasreen hopes to grow her business. She dreams of giving good, quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business

loans.use: to buy two more baby goats.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Ms Shakeela is a 40-year-old married woman who has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various items of everyday use. Ms Shakeela very well knows the art of retaining her customers. She is the mother of two children and she is motivated to provide for her family.

Since Ms Shakeela wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy more beverages, rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She would then be able to meet her customers' increasing demand consistently. Ms Shakeela is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital. Ms Shakeela also shared her dream: to build a new house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beverages, rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Tahzeem's Group

texts.en:
Tahzeem is a 36-year-old confident and independent woman. She lives in a rented house with her husband and daughter in the remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. All of her children are students and her husband is a government employee, but his income is inadequate to fulfill the family's needs and the household expenses. Tahzeem is an efficient and hardworking tailor who has been running a small tailoring business in her home since 2009. She provides tailoring services in her community. All of her customers appreciate her efficient and excellent skills.

Tahzeem's income plays a vital role in the family's income so she wants to continue her work in the future. However, her tailoring stock is inadequate and her sewing machine has stopped working so she is unable to continue her business. Due to lack of money, Tahzeem is unable to purchase the required items for her business.

As a member of a 6-person lending group, Tahzeem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase reels of threads in various colors, cloth, needles and one sewing machine. This will not only help her to continue her small business, but also to increase her net income. Tahzeem wants to use the profits to put aside some savings for her children's better future.

Note: In the picture Tahzeem holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a 55-year-old, married woman, from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. She has engaged in two businesses for the past 10 years: a sari-sari (convenience) store and a food preparation and vending business. Her husband is a tricycle driver. These activities are the source of her income.
 
Natividad is requesting a loan to buy rice, corn, and soft drinks, as inventory for her sari-sari, and oil, sugar, flour and other ingredients, for use in her food preparation and vending business. 

Natividad dreams that her business will be more productive, profitable and successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sari-sari store, and ingredients for her prepared foods business.

loans.name: Dukore Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Madame Drocella fait partie du groupe solidaire appelé DUKORE TWITEZIMBERE. Elle fait l’agriculture des ognons. Elle est divorcée, âgée de 44 ans et a 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 26 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école et a deux autres personnes en sa charge.
Elle est née au Rwanda et a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 7ème primaire.
En 2011 c’est quand elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd, et actuellement est au 3ème cycle de crédit. Les deux  premiers  cycles sont remboursés  sans aucun retard.
Pour le crédit demandé, elle  va acheter les semences et paiera la main d’œuvre avec la partie restant.
Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Comme stratégie, Madame Drocella  va utiliser les engrais chimiques dans ses champs. Cette stratégie permettra la croissance de son activité agricole.
Pour sa famille, elle va assurer le bien être de sa famille et construira une maison.
A part de l’activité financée, elle fait le commerce des aliments.
texts.en:
Drocella is a member of the joint-liability group called Dukore Twitezimbere. She is an onion farmer. Drocella is 44 years of age and divorced with six children. Her oldest is 26 and her youngest is eight years old. Two of her children currently attend school, and she has two other dependents in her care. She was born in Rwanda and attended school until the seventh primary.

In 2011 Drocella began working with ACB Ltd, and she is currently on her third loan cycle. Her first two loans were repaid in full. With her current loan, Drocella plans to purchase onion seeds and to pay for the labor required to work her fields. She does not expect to have any difficulties in repaying her loan.

Drocella uses chemical fertilizers in her fields. This strategy will enable her farming business to grow. Drocella plans to ensure the welfare of her family and build them a house. In addition to the farming for which she is seeking her loan, Drocella is also a food merchant.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and pay for the labor required to work her fields.

loans.name: Chimba - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CHIMBA – 32 está  compuesto por diez  integrantes siete mujeres y tres varones el presidente del banco es la Sr. Marco  tiene 33 años y tiene un hijito de 10 años que se encuentra en edad escolar, el se dedica  al transporte de pasajeros desde hace ya bastante tiempo que es chofer, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Marco utilizara este préstamo para el mantenimiento y compra de accesorios para su vehículo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital ya que este vehículo es su único medio de trabajo y con los ingresos que genera mantiene a su familia el Sr. Marco  se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The community bank CHIMBA – 32 is comprised of ten members, six of whom are women and four of whom are men.  

The president of the bank is Marco.  He is 33 years old and has made his living as a chauffeur for quite some time.  He has a little boy who is 10 years old and studying in school. 

This is his first loan with this institution.  He will use the funds for maintenance and to buy accessories for his vehicle.  He needs this loan as he lacks working capital, and he relies on this vehicle in order to do his job.  He supports his family with the income he generates.  He is happy and grateful for the support this institution is giving him.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle and to purchase accessories.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 65 years old.  Florencia is married and has two children.  

To make a living, Florencia grows corn.  She has engaged in this business for eight years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.  

In 2007, Florencia joined GDMPC.  Florencia is requesting a loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Kima

texts.en:
Kima is a 32-year-old woman who is married and has three children.  She would like to start growing taro, taamu, tomatoes, and beans to earn a living.
Kima has requested a loan to buy farming equipment.  She will purchase a wheelbarrow, file, and spade, as well as knapsack spray and chemicals. 

Kima will use her profits to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment.

loans.name: Nora Hortencia

texts.es: La Sra. Nora tiene 37 años, casada  con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 6, 8, 10 y 16 años,  la Sra. Nora  realiza la elaboración de colchones de paja más conocidos como payasas la cual vende a intermediarios q los llevan hacia las poblaciones más alejadas y rurales del departamento de La Paz, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Kalajahuira,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Nora va a usar este préstamo para la compra de materia prima que en este caso sería la paja que por el temporal de diciembre es de color verde por lo cual tarda en secarse para poderse utilizar en la elaboración de colchones para su negocio,  la Sra. Nora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son existen varias personas también que realizan la misma actividad  por lo cual deben tener una elaboración más rápida de los mismos colchones por lo cual, la inclemencia del tiempo y las bajas temperaturas puede causarles distintas dificultades,  va a utilizar los beneficios poder mejorar su realidad económica y también por la fecha de fin de año darle a su familia unos regalos y también pasar bien el fin de año. El deseo de la cliente es tener más producción para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Nora is 37 years old, married and has four children, ages 6, 8, 10, 1nd 16.  She makes straw mattresses called “payasas,” which she sells to salespeople who take them to population centers farther out form the rural areas of the La Paz department.  Her house is located in the Kalajahuira zone.  This will be her first loan through the institution.  Norma will use this loan to buy supplies such as straw because it’s still green in December and needs time to dry out so she can use it.

Norma has challenges in her business, among them is that she needs to speed up production.  The inclement weather and low temperatures cause her some problems.  She will use the benefits to improve her finances and give presents to her family at the end of the year.  She wants to improve her production so that she can get her son ahead.

loans.use: Compra de paja para fabricar colchones payasas

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 20 years old, lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Anita has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Anita has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new clothes to resell and will help Anita to generate greater profits and pay for some school supplies such as books and pencils. Anita hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a house for herself. 

Anita is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to resell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Mrs Yasmeen is 46 years old and a married woman. She has three children -- two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health care. Her husband works in a workshop, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. This compelled Yasmeen to start her own business, to contribute to the family income.

She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.

She requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy more spools of thread in various colors, with packs of buttons, zippers, and related items for sewing. With these in stock, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers, without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors, with packs of buttons, zippers, and related items for sewing.

loans.name: Anita's Group

texts.en:
Anita's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Anita is 22 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Anita has been working hard to manage her small business in clothing sales.

To help expand her business, Anita is requesting a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Anita to generate greater profits and pay for her family's medical expenses.

Anita hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for herself. 

Anita is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a twenty-six year old, married woman with four children living in Kasese,Uganda. Two years ago she decided to venture into food selling due to its ready market and also to support her husband who is a casual laborer. Like most good mothers she desires to see her children attain degrees as a minimum qualification.
Oliver has the challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuation, while her dreams are to have a food store and at least two outlets in other trading centers. Oliver intends to use the loan facility to buy cassava flour, maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj, 35 years old, lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the region of Tosontsengel in Zavhan province. His wife, Erdenetuya, is temporarily staying home to take care of their son, Batmandah, 6 years old, who goes to the local primary school.

Dagvadorj has been an assistant worker in his brother's small wooden furniture manufacturing business since 2004. He is now planning to open his own wooden furniture manufacturing in a spare ger on his plot of land. Dagvadorj is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory (wood) to start his wooden furniture manufacturing business. He is a hardworking, diligent and helpful person.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to start his wooden furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: Sibi

texts.fr: Mariée à un Electricien, Sibi est âgée de 41 ans et est mère d’un enfant de 11 ans scolarisé. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique. Elle a démarré son activité en l’an 2000 et sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour payer des pagnes et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle espère augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et avoir une famille épanouie.
texts.en: The wife of an electrician, Sibi is 41 years old and the mother of a 11-year-old who attends school. She sells "pagnes" (traditional West African printed cloth) and grocery products in her shop. She started her business in 2000 and is seeking her second loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase "pagnes" and groceries for her shop. Sibi hopes to increase her earnings and to have her family lead full, happy lives.

loans.use: to purchase "pagnes" (traditional West African printed cloth), and general grocery products.

loans.name: Mawouéna

texts.fr: Épouse d’un enseignant, Mawouéna est spécialisée dans la vente de pagnes  qu’elle a débuté en 2007 dans un marché de la place. Âgée de 56 ans elle est mère de 02 enfants âgées de 30 ans et 32 ans. Pour faire face à la mévente due au manque de la qualité de marchandises que désirent  les clients, elle sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat des pagnes. Elle veut destiner ses profits à l’achat de pagnes. Ses  ambitions  sont  d’ouvrir une boutique et  d’assurer aussi l’autosuffisance alimentaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mawouéna has been specializing in the sale of "pagnes" (traditional West African printed cloth) since 2007 in her local market. Mawouéna is 56 years old and the wife of a teacher. She and her husband have two children, aged 30 and 32 years old.

Mawouéna is seeking her third loan from WAGES to buy pagnes. She expects this to help combat the lack of recent sales, due to a shortage of quality goods as demanded by her customers. Mawouéna wants to use her earnings to purchase more pagnes. Her ambitions are to open her own shop and to ensure the self-sufficiency and nourishment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase "pagnes" (traditional West African printed cloth).

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon Antonio de 44 años de edad. Del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Marlon se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, trabajador, de buenas costumbres. Él se desempeña en una empresa de la localidad como auditor. Tiene tres hijos con edades de 19, 17,6. Todos están estudiando. El financiamiento lo está solicitando para realizar mejoras en su vivienda que consisten en construir el porche ya que se ha sido víctima de dos asaltos en su vivienda en dos ocasiones y quiere asegurar su vivienda y su familia. Marlon ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado  ser cumplido en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Gracias a los financiamiento que ha recibido de los prestamista kiva ha podido construir su casa, construyo dos cuartos y arreglo la sala. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: bloques, piedrín triturado, arena, cemento, hierro, zin, pintura, perlines. Marlon agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en: 44-year-old Marlon Antonio comes from the deparment of Chinandega, which is located in the western region of the country. Marlon is known to be a responsible and hardworking person with good moral values. He works as an auditor for a local company. He has three children aged 19, 17 and 6 years, and they're all in school. He's requesting this loan in order to do improvements on his home, namely building a porch, since he has twice been a victim of robbery in his house and he wishes to safeguard his home and family. Marlon has already worked with Fundación and he has proven to be diligent with his repayments both in terms of schedule and form. Thanks to the loans he received from Kiva lenders, he was able to build his house - he built two rooms and fixed up the living room. With this loan he'll purchase construction supplies such as bricks, crushed gravel, sand, cement, iron, zinc, paint, and beams. Marlon gives thanks for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent home to live in.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, crushed gravel, sand, cement, iron, zinc, paint, and beams.

loans.name: Paulita Isidra

texts.es: Paulita  Isidra de 67 años, madre soltera con 5 hijos mayores de edad e independiente. Originaria del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Paulita tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual consisten en vender productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobres de café, sobres de shampoo, cigarros por unidad. Aceite, pan, leche, gaseosas, jugos, detergentes, jabón, pollo. Esta actividad  la desempeña desde hace 30 ano. Actividad que surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Paulita ya ha trabajado con fundación León 2000 y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Paulita agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Paulita Isidra is 67 years old. She is a single mother with 5 children who are grown up and independent. She is from the Chinandega region, which is in the west of the country. Paulita operates a grocery store, located in her home. She sells everyday items in small quantities, including coffee sachets, sachets of shampoo, individual cigarettes, cooking oil, bread, milk, carbonated drinks, juices, detergents, soap and chicken. 

She has been carrying out this activity for the last 30 years. She started the business due to personal necessity, as a way to have work in order to be able to contribute to the household bills. She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and to stock her grocery store so as to provide a better service to her customers. Paulita has worked with Fundación León 2000 before and has demonstrated her responsible nature in making the correct payments on time. Paulita is grateful for the help given by the Kiva investors to people with scarce resources and in poor countries, such as Nicaragua, which helps create jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with everyday items, such as coffee sachets, shampoo, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen tiene 54  años de edad,  es soltera, tiene 3 hijos reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Carmen es maestra de profesión, labora como directora del Kínder de su comunidad. Con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos decidió desde hace un año establecer un negocio de venta de útiles escolares y de oficina.
Decidió solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de útiles escolares como cuadernos de espirar, cuadernos normales, lápiz grafito, lápiz de tinta, marcadores, papel bond y  cartulina.
Con el apoyo financiero ella espera aumentar sus ventas y con las utilidades remodelar su casa para establecer su negocio en dicha vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54, is single and has three children; she lives with her family in a community in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara Department.  Carmen is a teacher by profession; she works as a Kindergarten principal in her community.  With the goal of earning higher income, she opened a business selling school and office supplies a year ago.

She decided to request a 21,000 Lempira loan to buy school supplies like spiral notebooks, normal notebooks, graphite pencils, ball-point pens, markers,  bond paper and construction paper.  With the financial support she hopes to increase sales and use profits to remodel her house so she can install her business there.

loans.use: to buy school and office supplies.

loans.name: Karena Vanessa

texts.es:
La Señora Karena tiene 22  años de edad,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del Municipio de Másica, Departamento de Atlántida.
Karena hace 2 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y sandalias para caballeros y damas respectivamente.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a oficios domésticos con la intención de apoyar económicamente a su familia se vio motivada a establecer su negocio.
Con el propósito de surtir con producto nuevo y variado decidió solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 21000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de sandalias para caballeros y damas, ropa interior para ambos sexos y productos de achinería.
Ella se muestra optimista y motivada con su negocio, quiere ver a sus hijos crecer y ser un buen ejemplo para ellos.
texts.en:
Karena, 22, is married and has two children; she lives with her family in a community in Másica Municipality, Atlántida Department.  She’s been selling underwear and sandals for men and women for two years.  She used to work doing domestic work but wanting to help support her family economically she was motivated to start her business.

In order to stock up on new and varied products, she’s asking for a 21,000 Lempira loan to buy sandals for men and women and underwear for both genders as well as to buy low-cost novelty items.  She is optimistic and motivated about her business; she wants to see her children grow and wants to set a good example for them.

loans.use: to buy sandals, underwear and low-cost novelty items.

loans.name: 16 De Julio - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 16 DE JULIO – 32 está  compuesto por nueve  integrantes ocho mujeres y un varon la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Nelly tiene 26 años y tiene un hijito de la edad de 5 años,  La Sra. Nelly  se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo,  es promotora,  ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Nelly va a usar este préstamo  para comprar zapatos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio ya que esta época de fin año su demanda se incrementa ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Nelly enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The community bank "16 DE JULIO – 32" is comprised of 9 members, eight of whom are women.

The president of the bank is Nelly, who is 26 and has a 5-year-old son.  She sells shoes through catalogs.  She sells door-to-door, selling her products in public and private institutions and homes in various neighborhoods.

This is her first loan with this institution.  She will use the funds to buy shoes that are currently on sale so that she can have inventory for her business.  Since it is the end of the year, demand is increasing and she has many orders to fulfill.  Her reason for seeking this loan is so that she can have a variety of products in order to meet her customers' needs.  She faces challenges in her business, such has how to attend to her customers efficiently.

She will use her earnings to improve her family's quality of life.  This business is her only source of income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy footwear at wholesale.

loans.name: José Onan

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad  del Municipio de Arizona Departamento de Atlántida.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajo asalariado, pero la empresa para la cual laboraba cerro operaciones. Con el dinero obtenido de sus prestaciones laborales, decidió establecer un taller de soldadura y fabricación de estructuras metálicas.
En este momento ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de una soldadora, un taladro y una maquina pulidora.
Con el apoyo financiero lograra cumplir con algunos pedidos y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El espera  a futuro lograr construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en: José, 25, is single and has two children; he lives in a community in Arizona Municipality, Atlántida Department.  He used to be a salaried employee but the firm he worked for ceased to operate.  With the money he got from his liquidation package he decided to open a welding and metal shop.   At present, he’s asking for a 25,000 Lempira loan to buy a welding machine, a drill and a polishing machine.  With financial help he will be able to fill some orders and provide better customer service.  He hopes in future to be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy equipment like a welding machine, drill and a polishing machine.

loans.name: Shirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Shirley de 32 anos de edad, casada con hijos, ella es originaria del municipio de la paz centro, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de alimentos de ave. Shirley ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma.  El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo y ayudar con los gastos del hogar.  El objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar mas comida para aves, como trigo, maíz, sorgo, semillas de almendra. Shirley agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos par tener fuentes de trabajo digna.
texts.en:
Shirley, 32, is married with children. She is from the town La Paz Centro which is located in the western part of the country. She sells bird feed. 
Shirley has demonstrated that she is responsible through timely payments. The business arose due to the need to have a source of income and to help with household costs. 
The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to buy more bird feed such as wheat, corn, sorghum and almond seeds. 
Shirley is thankful for the Kiva investors who allow the small business owners with sparse resources to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy more bird feed such as wheat, corn, sorghum and almond seeds.

loans.name: Jhaneth

texts.es: Jhaneth, de 25 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Alan y sus 2 hijos: Angeluz y Pool, a los que cuidan en una casa alquilada desde hace 5 años. Como una pareja joven, todavía no poseen un capital económico estable. Ella trabaja cuidando a niños menores de 4 años, mientras su esposo trabaja como chofer. Estas actividades le brindan el sustento económico que requieren para sobrevivir. Pero ahorraron mucho para poder comprarse una casa propia, la cual se encuentra en construcción, aún le falta algunos acabados, pero ella confía en que terminaran, ya están dando el primer paso con la colocación de electricidad, por ese motivo desea su apoyo. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, de esa manera mejorará su calidad de vida. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jhaneth, invertirá el pago del fluido eléctrico de su casa pues no tiene luz, por ese motivo no puede trasladarse.
texts.en:
Twenty-five year old Jhaneth is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband Alan and their two children:  Angeluz and Pool, whom she cares for in a house they have been renting for 5 years.  Since they are a young couple, they still do not have stable economic capital.  

She works taking care of children under 4 years, while her husband works as a driver.  These activities provide them with the economic means they need to survive.  But they saved a lot to be able to buy their own house, which is currently under construction.  It still lacks some finishing touches, but she is confident that they will finish it.  They are already taking the first step of putting in electricity, which is why she needs your support.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the economic support they provide her.  It is in this way that she will continue to improve her quality of life.  She also promises to be punctual with her payments.  Jhaneth will invest the money in paying for power service; since her house does not have electricity, so she cannot yet move in.

loans.use: to pay for power service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y sociable, es viuda, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 22 y 28 años de edad, habitando cómodamente  en la casa de su hijo mayor.
El negocio que tiene, es la venta de pescado, pues su hijo pesca en los lagos. Para eso cuentan con un pequeño bote donde su hijo mayor sale a realizar las faenas de pesca, para luego venderlo al por mayor entre los comerciantes de los mercados de su localidad, asimismo lo vende al por menor en un puesto que tiene en el puerto de malecón de Yarina, contando solo con el apoyo de su hijo. Comenta que  su negocio es rentable  porque le ha generado muchas satisfacciones tanto personales como económicas ya que con los ingresos ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como comprarse enseres del hogar entre otros gustos, además comenta que con las buenas ganancias que le deja sobre todo en tiempos de escasez, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer para así tener más ingresos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles tiene planeado invertir en la compra de materiales para pesca como anzuelos, asimismo comprar materiales para el techado de su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Ines, 55, is a hardworking and earnest woman, as well as being cheerful and sociable. She is a widow and lives with her ​​two children of 22 and 28. They live comfortably in her eldest son's home.

Her business is selling fish; her son fishes in the lakes. To do this, they use a small boat which her eldest son uses to go out to catch fish, which she later sells wholesale to the local marketplace traders. Likewise, she also sells the fish retail from a stall in the Yarina port boardwalk, depending only on the help of her son. 

She says that his business is profitable because it has provided both financial and personal satisfaction since the income has allowed him to pay for household expenses, household goods and other expenses. She also says that with the good earnings that she sets aside, especially in times of scarcity, she plans to expand the business in order to have more income. With the loan she has requested for 1000 soles, she plans to invest in the purchase of materials such as fishing hooks and roofing materials for her stall.

loans.use: To buy fishing hooks and roofing materials for her stall.

loans.name: Noel De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Noel habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, Junto a su esposa ha sacado a sus hijos adelante, ella le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que es comerciante, su mayor aspiracion es tener su casi propia y darle mejores condiciones a sus hijos, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara Materiales: Perlines, Zinc, Pinturas etc, la moyor difucultad del señor Noel es lo imposible que se le hace recaudar el dinero de una sola vez para mejorar su hogar, Gracias a Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva lo han ayudado y brindado la con fianza para poder cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Señor Noel lives in the city of Ticuantepe.  Together with his wife, he has helped his children to get head.  His wife, who is a merchant, helps out with the household expenses.  Señor Noel's greatest aspiration is to have his own home and provide better living conditions for his children.  With this new financing, he will purchase materials: beams, zinc, paint etc.  Señor Noel's greatest difficulty is that he finds it impossible to put enough money aside all at once to make improvements to his home.  Thanks to Afodenic and Kiva, he has the financing needed to make his dream come true.

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia de 40 años es una mujer soltera. Tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 12 años, pero solo vive con la menor. Ella habita en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito de la selva central.
Aurelia es una mujer esmerada y constante. Hace 5 meses tuvo la idea de realizar un negocio rentable. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos lácteos como: manjar blanco, quesos, yogurt, y otros. Para ello viaja hasta la ciudad de Oxapampa, donde compra a precios módicos su mercadería. 
“Mis clientes son mis vecinos y amigos, son buenos pagadores y cada vez me hacen más pedidos”, comenta.
Cada 3 semanas se acaban sus productos y vuelve a viajar. Esa es rutina. Las ventas son rentables, por ejemplo, adquiere un kilo de quesos a 11 soles y los ofrece a 15. Sus ventas son mejores si adquiere mayor mercadería. Su trabajo de reparto inicia en las mañanas, ella llena sus productos en unas canastas o bateas y se dirige  a las casas de sus clientes. Le agrada su actividad.
Ella invierte de 1000 a 1500 soles en la compra de sus productos por mes, por eso solicita de su ayuda para continuar con tranquilidad con su trabajo. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP. Se siente agradecida por el apoyo recibido durante este tiempo, por su parte dice que será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería (quesos, manjar blanco y yogurt), los que ofrecerá a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Forty-year old Aurelia is a single woman.  She has two children who are 25 and 12 years old, but she lives with only the younger one.  She lives in her own house, located in a district in the central forest.  Aurelia is a conscientious and persevering woman.  

Five months ago, she had the idea to start a profitable business.  She makes her living buying and selling dairy products such as:  custard, cheeses, yogurt, and others.  For this, she travels to the city of Oxapampa, where she buys her merchandise at modest prices.  "My customers are my neighbors and friends; they are good payers and each time they place more orders," she comments.  Every three weeks she runs out of products and travels again.  This is routine.  

The sales are profitable.  For example, she buys a kilo of cheeses at 11 soles and sells them at 15. Her sales are better if she purchases more merchandise.  Her sales work begins in the mornings.  She fills baskets or trays with her products and goes to her customers' houses.  She likes this activity.  

She invests 1000 to 1500 soles per month purchasing her products, which is why she is asking for help to be able to continue her work with ease.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has received during this time, and says that she will be responsible with her repayments.

She belongs to the "Luz y Verdad" ("Light and Truth") community bank and likes her partners because they are supportive.  She will invest the money in the purchase of merchandise (cheeses, custard and yogurt), which she will offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cheeses, custard and yogurt.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, es conviviente con Julio quien es mototaxista. Vive en compañía de su pareja, sus 05 hijos menores. Habitan tranquilos en la casa de su mamá.
El trabajo que realiza Carla es la venta de golosinas, la cual lo realiza en la puerta de un Jardín de niños ubicado cerca a su domicilio, la cual  viene funcionando desde hace 05 años, siendo muy concurrido por los niños de este jardín y por los que pasan por la zona, a los cuales atiende de manera amable y con alegría, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos, en la atención al público.  
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le permite pagar los gastos de la casa,  y le da tiempo de ver a sus hijos. Asimismo comenta que mñás adelante desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sin dificultad, y exhibir toso sus productos, así podría tener más ingresos. Por tanto éste será su préstamo 02 con la institución MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo por que siente que son responsables, está agradecido con la institución por la confianza brindada, por lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Además espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.
Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará golosinas en general a precio por mayor para surtir su negocio, considera que a mayor variedad más acogida tendrá su negocio y obtendrá mayores márgenes  de ganancias.
texts.en:
Carla, 38, is a very cheerful, dynamic, enterprising woman.  She lives with Julio who is a moto taxi driver.  She lives with him and their five minor children.  They live in peace in her mother’s house.

Carla’s work consists in selling snacks at a Kindergarten’s entrance located near her house.  She’s been in business five years and it’s very popular with the children that attend this kindergarten and by those that pass by the zone.  She treats them kindly and cheerfully.  One of her children helps her with customer service.

What she likes about her activity is that it allows her to earn income to pay her household expenses and gives her time to care for her children. She also comments that in the future she would like to have a store where she can sell easily and show all of her products so that she can have more income.

This will be her second MFP loan.  She likes her group very much because she feels they are responsible and she’s grateful to the institution for the trust placed in her.  She commits to being punctual with her payments and she hopes for your collaboration to make her plans reality.

She will use the 1,000 new sol loan to buy snacks in general at wholesale to better stock her business.  She feels that with wider variety on hand her business will be better received and she’ll earn higher profit margins.

loans.use: to buy snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 32-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for six years and her business is located on a busy street, thus attracting many customers. Aida also sells timber and does farming for additional income. Aida is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour to sell. Her business plan is to sell wholesale and to open two more outlets in the nearby trading centers. As a good mother, she desires to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a 45-year-old married woman who has been selling used clothes for ten years. She purchases bundles of sweaters, shirts and trousers from the market at wholesale rates, cleans and presses the clothes and then sells them in her community. Ms. Yasmeen offers a variety of clothes to her customers in various colors and designs. She earns enough through her business to lead a decent life.

Ms. Yasmeen is a loving mother of three children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. Ms. Yasmeen has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. She has now requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy stock of winter sweaters and shirts in various designs. Ms. Yasmeen hopes to have more profits and hence better support for her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of winter sweaters and shirts in various designs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 26 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is married and has two children. Rosemarie cultivates bananas and coconuts for sale and earns PHP 4,000 each month doing this kind of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Rosemarie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes to provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for her banana and coconut trees.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe, 50 years old, is from Dela Paz, Clarin. She is widowed and has three children. Maria Fe has owned and operated a transportation service for 8 years, earning 10,000 PHP a month. Maria Fe joined GDMPC in 2005. She is requesting a loan of 21,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Maria Fe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Vugukora B / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe solidaire appelé VUGUKORA B. Il fait l’agriculture des choux. Il est marié, âgée de 30 ans et a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 11 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école et n’a  aucune autre personne en sa charge.
Il est né au Rwanda et a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6ème primaire.
En 2012 c’est quand il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd, et actuellement est au 2ème cycle de crédit. Le premier  cycle est remboursé  sans aucun retard.
Pour le crédit demandé, il  va acheter les semences et paiera la main d’œuvre avec la partie restant.
Il n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Comme stratégie, Monsieur Jean Bosco va utiliser les engrais chimiques dans ses champs. Cette stratégie permettra la croissance de son activité agricole.
Pour son business, il a l’ambition d’être le grossiste des produits agricoles.
Pour sa famille, il va éduquer ses enfants jusqu’à l’université.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the solidarity group VUGUKORA B and he is a cabbage farmer.  He is 30 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 11 and 3.  Three of his children go to school, and he has no other dependent.

He was born in Rwanda and is educated up to the 6th year of primary school.

In 2012, he joined ACB Ltd, and he is on his second loan cycle.  He repaid his first cycle without any delay.

With this new loan, he will buy seeds and will use the rest of the money to pay for the cost of labor.  He is not expecting any repayment difficulty.

His farming strategy is to cultivate his fields using chemical fertilizers, which will boost his farming business.

His ambition, in terms of business, is to become involved in the wholesale of agricultural products.  As for his family, he plans to continue to educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Cruz Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Cruz Domingo es viudo, tiene 59 años de edad, curso los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de de trajes chaquetas y pantalones, inicio este trabajo por iniciativa propia, hasta el momento lleva 35 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materia prima, consistente en telas y conos de hilos, ya que quiere mejorar su producción, tener mejores ventas y en el futuro tener un local propio para las ventas, de esta forma podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cruz Domingo is a widower. He is 59 year of age. He did 3 years of primary education. He has 4 children who are studying. He works making suits, jackets and trousers. He started this business himself, and has 35 years’ experience already.

He is requesting this loan which he will use to buy raw materials, consisting of fabric and thread cones, as he wants to improve production, increase sales and in the future establish his own premises where he can sell what he produces. In this way he can continue to support his children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread cones

loans.name: Monica Teresa

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer joven de 23 años, vive con su pareja Álvaro de 25 años que se dedica al comercio de frutas y su trabajo queda a media hora de donde viven. Tienen 2 hijos; Alexis de 6 años y Sebastián de 10 meses. A pesar de los obstáculos y la falta de recursos económicos ellos han salido adelante y esperan dar a sus hijos la educación que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de terminar. Mónica vive en el Pacto una parroquia del Cantón Quito ubicado en la Provincia de Pichincha en la República del Ecuador. Pacto está ubicado en el noroccidente del Distrito Metropolitano de Quito, su historia inicia en la época preincaica y su nombre se deriva de acuerdos realizados entre partidos políticos importantes. En cuanto a su economía, es una zona agrícola y ganadera, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Costa como de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Mónica se dedica a la producción de caña de azúcar desde hace 6 años, en esta actividad trabaja 10 horas diarias, cuidando, regando y cosechando los cultivos, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y luego con la experiencia que fue adquiriendo. Mónica es una joven muy emprendedora y motivada a seguir adelante siempre por ella, por sus hijos, por su familia. La ayuda de su hermana ha sido de mucho aporte en la puesta en marcha de este negocio y además el apoyo de su pareja. Mónica anhela prepararse para manejar de mejor forma su negocio, para lo cual espera incrementar sus ingresos con la producción mayor de cultivos y además insumos para el cuidado adecuado de los ya existentes para así no sufrir pérdidas. Fundación Alternativa ha facilitado a esta mujer luchadora un préstamo con el cual comprará semillas y los insumos necesarios para empezar con este paso de incrementar su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mónica, 23, is a young woman living with her partner, Álvaro, 25 who works selling fruit; his place of work is located half an hour from where they live.  They have two children, Alexis, 6, and Sebastián, 10 months.  Despite obstacles and the lack of economic resources, they’ve moved forward and hope to give their children the education they did not have the chance to complete.

Mónica lives in El Pacto in a parish in Quito Canton located in Pichincha Province in the Republic of Ecuador.  Pacto is located in the northwestern part of Quito Metropolitan District.  Its history started in the Pre-Inca period and its name comes from the pacts reached between important political parties.  As for its economy, it’s an agricultural and animal husbandry zone due to its climate and geography which results in harvests of crops from both the coastal and the mountain regions.  Its residents live day to day from these activities.  Even though it’s a place that’s far from the city, there are families that have started all sorts of activities to cover their needs and those of their community.

Mónica has been working growing sugarcane for six years.  She works 10 hours daily in this activity caring for, watering and harvesting crops.  She learned this activity from her parents and then with the experience she acquired.  Mónica is a very enterprising young woman who is motivated to get ahead through her own devices, for her children and for her family.  Her sister’s help has been of great support in getting her business going in addition to her spouse’s support.  

Mónica hopes to prepare herself to better manage her business and hopes to increase income producing larger crop yields and also supplies to adequately care for the already existing crops so as not to have any losses.

Fundación Alternativa has provided this tenacious woman with a loan to buy seeds and the necessary supplies to start this new step towards increasing business and as a result to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Las Claveles Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS CLAVELES está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Julieta  tiene 56 años y tiene un hijo de la edad de 35 años, ya independiente su hijo,  la Sra. Julieta se dedica a la venta material de ferretería como grifos para instalaciones de agua mangueras, herramientas,  tiene su ferretería,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Julieta va a usar este préstamo para la compra material de ferretería por mayor  para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos  a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Julieta va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así ir mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una ferretería muy surtida. La Sra. Julieta es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Claveles consists of eight members: five women and three men. Juliet, the president, is 56.  She has a 35-year old son who is independent. Juliet has a hardware store where she sells items like faucets for water pipe installations and tools.  

This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Juliet will use this loan to buy hardware store supplies wholesale so she can stock her business and thus provide variety of products to her customers. She is requesting this loan so she can keep improving her business. Juliet will use the benefits to continue purchasing products and bettering her income. She wants to have a well-stocked hardware store. Juliet is a very hardworking person; she is glad for the opportunity given to her and her fellow group members since in many cases, they are people who support their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy hardware store supplies.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is a 43 year old woman who lives in a rented house in Kawempe, a city out-skirts suburb, with her husband, who is a driver, and four school going children. She earns a living by collecting and buying metal scrap which she sells to metal recyclists. Proscovia has successfully serviced a loan of 300,000 UGX from UGAFODE (MDI) LTD, which she used to expand her business into two collection centers and also to partly pay her children’s school fees. 
She has now applied for a second loan of 500,000 UGX to buy more scrap for increased profits.
